text: Barwa ciemnej herbaty, nalewa się z obfita pianą. Aromat wędzonego słodu (idący w stronę szynkowej wędzonki) i karmel. W smaku również intensywna wędzonka, tym razem bardziej przypominająca mocno spieczone, wręcz nadwęglone kiełbaski z ogniska. Oprócz tego nuty chlebowe, karmelowe. Wytrawne, z wyraźną palono-ziołową goryczką. Dość wysokie wysycenie. godne polecenia, szczególnie dla miłośników wędzonki.

Zapach drewna, szynkowy ale szynka nie taka jak z opowiadań, troszkę słabsza, lekki karmel, nuty słodów używanych do dolnej fermentacji. Pian bujna, drobna, barwa bursztynowo-miedziana. Smak przyjemny, wytrawny, szynkowy, goryczka średnia, lekka kwaśność.
Tap @Fermentoren, Cph. Dark brown, light beige froth. Smoky, woody aroma, sausage. Smoky, meaty flavour. Malty with lasting wood and smoke. Very drinkable, nice.

Bardzo zacna klasyka. Aromat kojarzy się z bekonem i kiełbaską. W smaku wędzonka ma podobny charakter, a wspomagana jest delikatną goryczką i gładkością. świetny balans. Barwa miedziana. Do tego wysoka, trwała piana. Lubię.

A dark copper to brown color. Aroma is super smokey with some caramel, bacon, and ham. The flavor is actually on the light side with the smoke shining through. Lots of smoked meat. This is drier than some from Aecht and less malty good as always from them..
A nice smoked beer. It manages to be smoky and still easy to drink. Also the sweetness is done so that it remains somehow a refreshing drink. Not something to die for, but a solid beer.

500ml bottle from "Bierothek", Bamberg. Thick offwhite head. Smoky, slightly malty campfire aromas. Dark amber colour. 
Taste: very Smoky, still highly refreshing and drinkable, slightly sweetish aftertaste - very nice!

Bottle from the Good Spirits Co. Wine & Beer. Pours a crystal clear red/amber with a persistent tan frothy head. Nose is all smoke - smoked ham, hickory, 
smoked cheese; clean, lighter smoke, nothing earthy or heavy. Taste is sweet, malty, and very smoky. Palate is light bodied, with active high carbonation and a slightly mineralic finish. A cracking beer, albeit very one-note.
Opaque thick brown pour with a light tan head. Mild smoke aroma. Mild smoked malt flavor with a herbal and floral hop notes and a bitter finish. Nice mild smoked beer.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 Mocny, choć nie tak, jak w Urbocku, aromat wędzonki. Pod nim słodowe, chlebowe nuty. W smaku intensywna nuta dymu; słodowe, ale nie słodkie, chlebowe smaki; trochę goryczki. Fajne.

Prawie wszystko czego oczekiwałem po tym piwie dostałem. Zapach intensywnie wędzony, taka ogniskowa szynka, mięsny i dymny. W smaku podobnie, jak woda po gotowaniu wędzonego mięsa. Wysycone całkiem wysoko, przyjemne w odbiorze. Wędzonka dość ostra, mięsista, dymna. Nie jest puste, wędzonka jest fajnie podbita słodowością.

Aromat: Szynka, szynka, szynka, wędzonka. Ręce same składają się do oklasków 
Wygląd: Ciemnoczerwona, pełna barwa. Piania średnia. 
Smak: Dosyć pusto. Wędzonka dalej szynkowa, może delikatnie ogniskowa, w miarę ocieplania piwa wychodzą delikatne żygowinki i kwas. Niezbyt przyjemne 
Odczucie w ustach: Trochę za dużo gazu, przeszkadza. Goryczka mała, wyczuwalna. Alkoholu brak 
Ogólnie: Dosyć miłe piwo, ale nie równa się do swoich braci.

Pięknie to pachnie. Lekko słodka, mocno wędzona swojska szynka. W smaku bardzo gładko, słodowo, trochę biszkoptowo, lekko się pije. Taką wędzonkę lubię, intensywnie szynkową a przy tym dziwnie słodką. W sumie w każdej Schlenkerli taką właśnie wędzonkę można uświadczyć. Za to szanuje ten browar.

Pours a vibrant ember color with a huge, fluffy big head, which wont receed at all. 

Smells of rather light malts, enhancing the bright appearance of the beer, which gets enriched by prominent smoke and burned out camp fire. A hoppy undertone completes the nose by adding just a herbal note to the very inviting aromas.

Has a light, refreshing body with a lively carbonation, effectivly balancing the dominant smoke which becomes immediately apparent on the palate.

Establishes an early hazelnut earthiness with a good amount of roast, soothed by caramel and a touch of toffee. All of this gets amped up by the most prominent smokiness, which is like biting into a honeyed, grilled ham. Then the flavors take another turn, this time heading into a herbal, dry direction, together with an effervescent mineralic quality.

Awesome Rauch, intense and refreshing at the same time with a challenging flavor profile and a surprisingly dry, hop defined ending.
Barwa miedziana, piwo klarowne. aromat to ogniskowo-szynkowa wedzonka. W smaku slodkie, wedzone, z nuta palonego karmelu.
Draught. The taste is mostly that of smoke although there seems to be something sweet there too. Im not sure what the difference to the regular version is.

20. 4. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Shared with Viki. The benchmark of rauchbeer. Very well balanced roasted malt with excellent aroma and even sessionally drinkable flavour and mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wieczór przy ognisku. pięknie dymione piwo, nie bardzo rozróżniam te schlenkerle, wszystkie ich wędzonki są podobne i równie smaczne.

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours dark amber with whitish foam. Aroma is smoked, but delicate, and malty. Body is medium-dense with good carbonation and some stickiness. Taste is sweet at first, though a good bitterness comes up. Finish is long enough and pleasant.

Bottle (2016 batch). Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting. Body is hazy medium brown. Aroma is moderately malty (caramel, toasted bread, roasted grain), with notes of savory smoke (meat and wood), peach, blackberry, autumn leaves, brown sugar. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

I bought a bottle of this online not knowing it was last years batch, and was depressed to see the neck label when I opened the box. Then I thought about the good experience I had with a 6-7 year old bottle of unfiltered Eiche, and crossed my fingers this would still have some life left in it too. And wow, does it ever! This is perhaps more enjoyable than even a homemade blend of Maerzen and Urbock (which is my favorite Schlenkerla), especially wrt the mouthfeel. Arrrgghhh, why doesnt Heller leave all their bottles unfiltered??? Maerzen is so thin and watery (and kinda fizzy too) from bottle. If they would just leave the magical yeast in there, that stuff would last on the shelf sooooo much better. This and the aged Eiche are all the evidence you need for that. Regardless, as good as this is at a year old, I hope to somehow get my hands on a 2017 bottle before the summers out.

Bottle in Seattle. From Belmont Station. 2016 edition. Id love to try this fresh. On SinH4s recommendation, I made sure to try this on Easter, in true fastenbier tradition. Thick eggshell head, rising aggressively. Lovely hazy brown, clear light edges. Clean sweet malt and a smooth, delicious Schlenkerla smoke. Bitter brown malt flavors, flavorful and tasty Franconian style. Smoke is understated, especially compared to the other beers from this brewery. Fairly sweet wood and fruit, followed by a bracing bitterness. I wonder what this might have lost with age, and I look forward to revisiting it.
@Stordirren 17-4-16: trevlig doft av skinka, torv och träd. Ganska lätt men fint balanserad smak med tydlig rök samt salt skinka. Gott och stabilt.
This rating is not about the quality of the beer. Point is that very apparently smoke(d) beer is not my thing, therefore the relatively low rating.

500ml bottle. Clear dark amber color. Huge size, yellowish head, stays. Sausage, caramel, sweetish, smoked, leather in aroma. Candy, sweet, smoked, woody, fatty sausages in taste. Fatty smoked sausages in aftertaste. Goes down very easy. Nice full body. Very solid brew.

Zapach intensywny, wędzonka, oscypek, ognisko, szynka, słód, chleb. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, słód, wędzonka, drewno, ognisko, szynka, karmel, chleb, zioła. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.

Couleur brune-ambrée sombre, légère mousse. Nez fumé vieux bois note vieux fruits sucrés et caramel. Gout fumé, bois fumé, note un peu douce sur le fruité et caramalt. Bon corps un peu onctueux. Fin sur leger fumé et malté note sucrée. Nickel

Butelka 0.5l (BB 11.2017). Piwo klarowne o ciemno brązowej barwie z bardzo obfitą pianą koloru ecru o kremowej konsystencji, która opadając dokładnie oblepia ścianki szkła. Aromat jak można się spodziewać to porządne uderzenie wędzonki i to tej najlepszej ogniskowej, uzyskanej ze słodu wędzonego dębem, bardzo intensywnej i bardzo wyraźnej, ma się uczucie jakby się siedziało przy ognisku. W smaku delikatne, słodkawe z wyraźną goryczką, przyjemnie wędzone, wyraźnie ale nienachalnie, idealnie zbalansowane. Piwo jest pełne w odbiorze, gładkie, po prostu bardzo smaczne.
Medium dark brown reddish color with big head. Aroma is really smoky. Flavor malt, smoke.

Brązowe, przejrzyste z obfitą białą pianą, która długo sie utrzymuje i ładnie zdobi szkło. W aromacie wędzonka, z początku bardziej oscypek, później wychodzi bardziej kiełbasa z ogniska. Przed ogrzaniem wyczuwalny była też nuta słodowa, ale dalej totalna dominacja wędzonki. W smaku podobnie. Nie ma słodyczy. Na pierwszym planie drewno z finiszem ogniskowym, wędzonkowym. Jest mocno słodowe, chlebowe, nieco karmelowe. Goryczka odczuwalna. Piwo jest bardzo treściwe, średnio nagazowane. Zdecydowanie dominuje wędzoność, ale przyjemnie się pije i mimo wszystko jest nieźle zbalansowane, nie męczy. Świetny wybór dla fanów piw dymionych
UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Stipraus deg?siu aromato alus persipynes su lengvu sald?siu. Idomaus intensyvaus skonio.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Bottle. Pours brown with medium slightly tan head. Aroma is bacon, smoke, ham, malts. Taste is bitter with a sharp malty and smoky note, bread and roasty. Good.

Piana dość wysoka, drobna, gęsto zdobi szkło. W aromacie mnóstwo oscypka, później ta wędzonka bardziej podchodzi mi pod kiełbasę. Jest intensywnie, przyjemnie, choć nie ukrywajmy, wędzonka przykrywa wszystko inne. W smaku karmelowe, opiekane, ale co najważniejsze, wcale nie słodkie. A mimo to jest dość pełne, pełniejsze niż co niektóre koźlaki. Fura wędzonki, która w smaku wchodzi znów bardziej w drewniano-ogniskową. Miejsce na ziołową goryczkę też się znalazło. I na kiełbasiany posmak po niej. Dość wysokie wysycenie. Mmmm, jak to się dobrze pije. Poziom marcowego conajmniej.

Pours brown from the bottle, has a lightly reddish hue, and leaves a full, creamy head. The aroma is smokehouse. The taste is the beers strength. More sweet than bitter with lots of smoked flavor, but also an underlying berry tartness and hints of caramel. The body just barely reaches medium, though the intensely smokey notes can easily mislead. Perhaps just as well, since more smoke and less water might make this a less enjoyable experience. Overall, very good.

Z butelki kapitalna serowa wędzonka. Wygląd nienaganny, kolor miedziany, przejrzyste, piana wysoka, długo się utrzymuje. W smaku wędzonki mniej, ale wciąż raczej dominująca. Jest też słodkie, skontrowane ziołową goryczką. Pełne, treściwe, świetne piwo.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. Best before 10/2016. A sparkling dark chestnut beer with a big off-white foamy head ; good retention ; ok lacing. Smoke (+), light caramel, roast, herbal note. Medium round sweet, light dry fresh bitter ; light warming atmosphere. Medium body, light to medium silky texture, average carbonation, light dry smoky fresh finish. Overall, great ! First, I was worried but this beer is still awesome 6 months after the "best-before" date.
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat bardzo przyjemny, wędzony, szynkowy. W smaku karmel, szynka, pełne, świetne.
Wooden keg at Joutsen. Dark brown with xl lasting head. Smoky, quite sweet. Thick texture. Round mild bitterness.

Bottle 
Aroma-smoke, bread
Appearance-amber, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle. Unclear dark red colour, rocky tan head, good lacing. Intense aroma of smoke, bacon, ham, wood, caramel. Taste is medium- sweet and medium bitter: caramel, bread malt base, intense smoke, bacon, roasty bitterness. Medium body and carbonation, thin texture. Has very intense, rich smoke in aroma and taste, but also slightly too high bitterness and too thin texture. Very good beer, but not my favourite from Heller.

Happy to have this one on bottle as it was previously only on tap at the brewery, so 50cl bottle @Kehl. A cark amber beer with low head, nose is already intense on smoked notes, caramel, wood, vegetable touch. Aroma is intense on smoked notes, caramel, vegetables, typically on the german side, like a smoked porter, but less complex than expected especially compared to the eche one. Anyway a very good one.
Bottle shared by JK - thanks!! Massive smoked malt and bacon nose. Dark amber pour with a nice off white head. Malty and smoky. Really nice!
Bottle shared by JK, thanks John. Cloudy copper pour with sediment. Huge smokey meat aroma. Taste follows, nice smoked meat taste, perfect carb. Great smoked beer.

Wędzonka fest , trochę karmelu i tye . Zdecydowanie brakuje pełni .Całość jest zdominowane przez drzewną wędzonkę. Jakby ktoś do mocno posłodzonej i przestudzonej herbaty włożył kijek opalany w mrowisku i dolał rumu .

Piwo ciemno rubinowe, bardzo klarowne, piana raczej słaba, szkła nie zdobi. Aromat - ekstremalne aromaty ogniskowe i wędzarniane, lekko popiołowy. Smak - bez zaskoczenia - ekstremalnie wędzony, ogniskowy, szynkowy, stosunkowo słodki. Zaskakująco wyczuwalna, ziołowa goryczka. Sporo ciała, wysycenie w normie. Posmak długi, wędzony, popiołowy, lekko karmelowy. Wędzona doskonałość.

W aromacie spora wędzonka, typowy styl schlenkerli, czyli wpierw ognisko, potem szynka. Śliwka. Nieco chmielu. W smaku jest różnica głównie jeśli chodzi o goryczke, Jest tu wysoka jak na styl, walczy z wędzonką. Po czasie pijalność spada. Niemniej jednak piwo udane.

Bottle from systembolaget. Maybe Im a pleb, but I didnt see too much different with the Marzen. It still had that serious heaviness so again, not a great post dinner choice, but then I cant think of a perfect moment for this beer really. Heavy malts, huge smoke profile but doesnt linger Is The mouth which is nice. Of course a very decent beer.

Butelka z datą: 11/2017
AROMAT: Bardzo intensywny. Króluje wędzonka (mocno uwędzona szynka).
SMAK: Słodowe z przyjemną wędzonością w posmaku. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, krótka.
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobursztynowa przechodząca w miedzianą, klarowne. Pian średniej wysokości, drobna.
OGÓLNIE: Urzekająca wręcz dymioność tego piwa sprawia, że na pewno kiedyś do niego wrócę. Klasa!

Awesome smoky notes in aroma, typical for Schlenkerla. Feels like fireplce with still burning wood in it. Similar notes in taste. Its rather calm and polite in the beginning, but its getting more and more agressive, burned, smoked every second, till the very end when it is finished with really nice bitterness - still burned one. Its very pleasant in the mouth, drinkale, full in thaste but still refreshing. Really good brew, but yet not my favourite from the brewery.
Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Roma. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich bacon, sausage, smoke, malt and hops.
Znakomity aromat wędzonki. Wysycenie w normie. Bardzo dobre, orzeźwiające i pijalne. Schlenkerla trzyma fason.

Aromat - bardzo intensywna wędzonka bukowa, do tego suszone śliwki i ciemny chleb. Bardzo przyjemny i ułożony.
Dość lekkie, wyraźnie wędzone i śliwkowe. Goryczka średnio niska, palona, zalega.

0,5 l bottle BB 08/2017 from Biervana 
Amber-Red color, clear, frothy / creamy tan foam head. Aroma is Smoke, Ham. light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Vycap Kulovy blesk. Tmava jantarova az cierna farba, hneda pena. Vona udena od zaciatku do konca. Jemne karamel, ovocie, udena slanina. Chut opat udena od zaciatku do konca. Ovocne tony, udena slanina, trosku prazene slady. Stredne telo, vyssia nasytenost. Velmi dlha udena dochut. Prijemne na pitie.
Copper colored, huge beige head. Smoked aromas of meat, salt, sausages and charcoal with caramel and fudge. Taste of malt, smoked meat, caramel, burnt sugar and tar pastilles. Pretty good.
Aroma: smoked ham, yeast, malts and grain. Taste: yeast, smoked notes, malts, really refreshing. Nice head, good lacing and medium carbonation.
Aromat wędzonki - wędzona szynka, boczek. W smaku mniej, ale również wyczuwalne wędzenie. Jest też chlebowo i słodowo. Wszystko okraszone ziołową goryczką. Świetne piwo
Sehr gut im abgang und es macht viel spass es zu trinken. Flasche gefällt mir besonders gut.

butelka. ciemnobursztynowe, obfita czapka, grubopęcherzykowej, białej piany, utrzymującej się do końca picia. w aromacie szynka, kiełbasa, boczek wędzony, po czasie jak człowiek przyzwyczai się do wędzonki, czuć również wyraźną słodowość. w smaku wędzonka, rześkie, nasycenie średnie. super

500 ml bottle.
Sweet, malty aroma with a clear smokey note. Taste is bitter, earthy and wooden notes with a light to medium smokiness. Everything well balanced with the malt. Very drinkable. Smooth mouthfeel. Schlenkerla doesnt disappoint.

Aromat to na prawdę solidna porcja oscypkowo ogniskowej wędzonki z lekką podbudową slodową, nuty wędzone są przepiekne-wędzony ser i wędliny bardzo intensywne. Od strony wizualnej piwo także zdaje swój egzamin: ma brunatno rubinowy kolor z ładnymi przeblyskami. Kalrowne. Obfita jasna piana utrzymuje się długo i zdobi szkło. W smaku dominuje także wędzonka wzbogacona jeszcze o nuty świeżo świętego drewna. Do tego przyjemna chlebowa nuta, oraz karmelowe słody. Piwo średnio nasycone. Pełne i treściwe.

Draught. Reddish colour, nice head. Classic aroma of Schlenkerla, nice sausage like notes, light sweetish caramel too. In taste similar, clean profile with medium malty side and great smokiness. Medium to light body, finish rather on the sweet side. Smoky and drinkable beer.

Bottle, poured a copper like chesnut colour with a off head. Nose of big smoked malts upfront, malt, caramel, smoked meat, light apples (maybe from the hops)burned caramel, and light ashy, Nice fresh hop bitter finish. Enjoyable
Wygląd obłędny, zapach również, trochę gorzej ze smakiem, piwo pełne, ale mogłoby się tu dziać trochę więcej, przy ocieplaniu się jednak znacznie zyskuje

Miedziane piwo o średniej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat mocno wędzony, dla mnie kojarzy się z oscypkiem czy wędzoną szynką. W smaku słodkie, gęste, wędzone, w tle czuć zioła. Goryczka średnia, ziołowa. Ogólnie bardzo udane i ułożone wędzone piwo, pozycja obowiązkowa dla każdego fana stylu.

Amber colour, medium head. Aroma: smoke, smoke and some dry fruits hints. Medium level of body, sweetness and bitterness. Very balanced, very dominated by smoked malt with noticable clean cereal profile
Piwo ciemny bursztyn z ładną pianą. Aromat wędzonki, szynki, oscypek. Smak pełen, wędzonka, oscypek, szynka. Dobre piwo, ale nawet z tego browaru są lepsze pozycje.

Nos: ogniskowa wędzonka, drewno, dym, troszkę kiełbasy/boczku, słodowość chlebowa. W smaku nadpalone drewno, trochę suszonego dymem mięsa, w tle chleb na zakwasie. Dość pełne, słodycz umiarkowana, wysycenie średnie w kierunku wysokiego, mogłoby być nieco niższe, ale i tak wszystko mieści się w granicach stylu.

Piwo barwy ciemnego bursztynu, aż lekko wpada w bordowy, opalizujące. Piana wysoka, drobna, trwała. W aromacie bardzo mocna wędzonka w stylu szynkowo/oscypkowym, świetny aromat. W smaku pełne, słód miesza się z wędzonką, która z kolei utrzymuje się długo w posmaku. Gdzieś tam pałęta się jeszcze karmelowa nutka. Goryczka niska, raczej ziołowa. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego.

Troszkę spodziewałem sie więcej po tym piwie ale jest spoko. Czuć wędzonkę kiełbasianą, w szkle piwo prezentuje sie ślicznie. Troszkę wysycenie mogło by być niższe żeby nadać gładkości ale to czepianie sie. ;)

Bottle. Aroma- good combination of smokiness (mainly ham- and some wood-like) and maltyness (bready and toasty). Copper, clear, with a medium-low, beige head. Taste- smokiness balanced with a malty notes. Nice, hopy aftertaste. Medium-bodied, medium-low carbonation. Interesting and tasty beer.

Bottle brought by gramity to RBAG winter event. Medium orange amber average off white head. Classic smoked meat character steals the show, with spicy caramel as an afterthought. This is all about the smoke show, and if youre not along for the ride, then you might as well fuck off. Bamberg smoked malt is the real deal. Love it.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Barwa- ciemny bursztyn, obfita drobnopęcherzykowa piana. W aromacie wędzonka, gdzieś tam się przebija nieśmiało karmel. W smaku również intensywna wędzonka, karmelowa słodycz, ziołowa goryczka, delikatna rodzynka. Jest dobrze, ale nie jest to dla mnie najlepsza pozycja z tego browaru.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Tap. Clear very dark ruby in the glass with a thick frothy beige head. Aroma of pretty intense smoked ham and slight caramel maltiness. Taste is semi-sweet, with low bitterness; flavors of intense smokiness, notes of ash and dust, malt. Smokey and a surprisingly astringent finish. Full bodied, slick texture, medium to low carbonation.

On tap. Aroma of smoked meat - especially ham and some caramel maltiness. Clear ruby in the glass with thick beige head. Taste of literally burned maltiness, some ashy, dusty notes. Bit of caramel in the background with gentle smokiness. Roasty astringent finish. Very drinkable as Rauchbier, but not the best from Schlenkerla.

Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, piwo jest nieprzejrzyste; całkiem ładna piana. W aromacie dominuje oczywiście wędzonka - przede wszystkim kojarząca się z wędzonymi serami. Dalej trochę karmelu i jasnych słodów. W smaku raczej podobnie. Mocna, przyjemna wędzonka serowo-szynkowa. Piwo jest zdecydowanie pełne, słodkie, czuć troche chleba i karmelu. Pije się powoli ale przyjemnie. Goryczka niska.

Kolor: miedziany, zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów wędzonki, dymu, lekkie aromaty słodowe, melanoidynowe.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, sporo nut dymnych, wędzonych, trochę nut słodowych, melanoidyn, karmelu, nut opiekanych, lekka słodycz, goryczka średnia.
Wysycenie: średnie.

Butelka 500mll. pite w domu. Kolor brązowy, klarowny, piana drobnopęcherzykowa jasnobeżowa dobrze trzyma się szkła. Aromat wędzonki dość intensywny, suszone śliwki palone słody, w smaku to samo. Goryczka mocna zalegająca, wysycenie średnie. Piwo o potężnym smaku i aromacie, bardzo dobry rauchbier. Bamberg wymiata.

Pours deep amber with thick head.
Aroma: oscypek, smoked ham, campfire, caramel, bread (I am not sure about that) and more oscypek.
Taste: smoky bitterness at first, caramely sweetness.
Medium body, a little bit creamy texture, average/soft carbonation, short bitter finish, aftertaste of oscypek and ham. I would say its a textbook rauchbier. Nothing eccentric, just good.

Bottle. Bought Dec 2016; BBE Dec 2016; Drank Dec 2016 - Aroma of Smokey Bacon. Cloudy Reddish Brown in colour. Large creamy off-white head. Excellent lacing. Very Malty; smoked malts, ham, roasty, bready, oak, caramel, ashy notes. Yeasty; sedimented. Hoppy; moderately hopped; light hop bitterness. Well balanced. Sweet very smokey roast malty throughout. Semi-dry and mildly bitter in the finish. Very drinkable. Wow! Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific Smokebeer! (2016-12-31)

Bottle to stange
Consummation: Smoked malt, loads of bitterness, bread, yeast, middling sweetness
Adjunct: Aroma is almost completely smoky. That is, smoked malt, bacon, and smoked gouda; fairly clear amber with lots of tiny particulates that look like little smoke clouds along with a thick, creamy, light tan head with good retention and lots of lacing.
Bottle. Loads of bacon on the nose. Pours dark brown and cloudy with a thick cream head. Really bacon to taste and really good.

Pours a dark cola colour with a light tan head, and not my lacing. The taste is breadiness and of course the smoke but it doesnt overwhelm, instead gives depth. Almost like roast beef and gravy, or at least makes me want so to go with. Excellent beer and well worth looking for.

This is great. Dark brown and cloudy with a good layer of beige head. Body is medium to full and well carbonated. The nose is more smoked Bavarian cheese than the smoky bacon of its sister beers. Taste has more wispy smoke, burnt toffee, red berries, spicy dark fruit and a crisp lager- like bitterness.

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a substantial off white head which retains and laces well. The aroma is smoked Bavarian cheese and fruit. The taste is really good, medium bodied, light/medium sweet and very light bitterness.

#950Bottle 0.5l. Chestnut brown body, small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, sausages, bark, malts. Taste is neutral, slightly sweet and bitter. Delicious smokiness, sausages, malts. Medium body and carbonation. Noble smoke lager, great.

Bottle 0.5l. Lightly cloudy, deep amber to copper colored. AROMA- smoke, good sausage, touch of caramel and red berries. FLAVOR- neutral, pleasantly smoky bitter, complex flavor of smoke, honey, dark caramel and red berries. Medium to fuller bodied. Very good.

Bottle from Beer Cartel 191016. Smooth and smokey just the way I like my Rauchbiers. While it might look a bit thin bodied in the glass it is not. Plenty of smoke in both the aroma and the flavour, almost smoked ham like. This is another in the fine line of Aecht Schlenkerla beers.
Tap. Very pleasant Scherlenkerla, but I prefer the Marzen and the Weizen.. This is a little more straight forward and not quite so rewarding.

Aroma; smoked malts, leather, tar, leaves n old grass. Look; beige big head, brown body. Taste; roasted malts, smoked malts, peat, grassy hops, soft caramels - smoked stuff fading away and leading to a malty finish. Feel; alright. Overall; tasty brew, and the smoke isnt that strong in taste as in aroma. [50cl.btl 5.5% BB.10.2016]
Halve literfles gekocht in Berlijn. Bruinrood/ koper kleurig, kraag verdwijnt snel. Spek,rook en moutig van geur. Smaak is ook spekkig, rokerig, bitterzoet. Wat dunne afdronk.
Bottle in Germany. Aroma of smoked malts, eel, bacon, sugars and fruits. Flavor is quite sweet, thick bodied and smooth. Very well balanced rauchbier.

Opened today when Wiesn (Oktoberfest) Started. Coz za zapach, wedzonego i spalonego drewna, sliwka wegierka, gruszka wedzona, jablko z ogniska. Kolor metny brazowo czerwony, fantastyczna metnosc i ta bezowa spora piana, ktora stoji niewzruszona caly czas. Smak poteznie wedzony, lekko slodowy, wedzony ser, szynka serrano lub inna regionalna, a do tego goryczka w gardle zalepiajaca i zalegajaca bardzo dlugo. Kunszt i klasa Rauchbier, nie dziwi tak wysoka ocena. Lovely Smoked Beer.

fastenbier 
very tasty, smokey, but also silky.you can find it only strict period.it belong to the spring

Appearance: dark Guinness-style colour with a big dirty white head. Nose: caramel, smoky bacon, roasted malt, wood chips and some sort of metallic smell. Taste: Smoky bacon at the start, some red fruits similar to a red wine, brown sugar, charcoal and roasted malts. Finishes slightly sweet with light bitterness. An interesting and complex beer. Price Paid: £2.10.

Bottle. Murky amber-brown pour with a thick, pillowy off-white head. Both aroma and taste are fairly smokey, but nicely integrated and balanced with the rest of the beer. Fairly rich for the ABV, malty but also complex and delicious. Really tasty and surprisingly drinkable for a smoked beer - wish I could get this more often.
Stronger taste version of a smoke beer from this brewer. Delicous beer. Clear dark amber. Very easy to drink. Perfect taste, aroma superb, palete unforgettable. My, my, hey, hey, great stuff!
bottle at home ... copper ... smalll tan head ... soft smoke sweet herbal tofffee smoke malt nose ... big smokey bacon ... loing soft smoke... just not me

On tap at the Hereford Beer House, June, 2016. Deep amber in colour, with a faint haze and decent, frothy, beige head. Smoked wood chips, slightly fatty bacon, sweetish red berries and a touch of leafy hop, before a full finish with accompanying smoke. A great beer.

Deep hazy amberish brown under a rocky and sticky light tan head. Mild aroma thats a little smokey, a little meaty, a little toasty and something kinda semisweet, like date fruit. Smooth and balanced flavors thats slightly smokey, somewhat toast-y, bready, gently sweet and medium flavored. Quaffable, clean, balanced and not overbearing for a smoked. Just kinda even tempered.

Robe caramel foncé, grosse carbo, gros collet persistant.
Bien marquée sur les notes fumées, du caramel derriere.
Relativement mince et comme toujours avec cette brasserie elle se boit tres bien meme avec un niveau eleve de fumé.

Aroma is deeply smoked grains, hickory, deep rich malts, caramel, ash and pepperoni . Taste is rich malts, smoked malts, caramel, clove, earthiness and slight oakiness. Appearance is a clear dark amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well .
Delicious! My favorite rauchbier so far. Deep flavors, good smoke, beautiful n my glass. What else could I want?

500ml Bottle- Brown in colour. Beech, berries and ash in the aroma. Caramel, beech, ash and maple can all be detected in the smoky and slightly nutty taste. Some raisins can be detected in the finish. Tasty but very rich.

Never ever get sick of these Aecht beers. Maybe I should smarten up and put them all side by side so I can actually nail down the differences. Seriously smooth smoky meatness, caramelness, slight sweet pepperiness. Soft. Taste follows in the same vein but with a decent chew to it. Actually noticing the hops which is cool. Drying with an obvious hop bite. The taste seems to be a blend of meat and cheese when comparing the smokes in each. Short, mainly undetailed review as I just want to enjoy.

Erittäin kaunis olut. Punertavanruskea, kirkas ja todella tiiviin/tiheän pienikuplaisen vaahdon omaava kokonaisuus. Vaahto ikäänkuin pilveilee ja kumpuilee tiiviisti oluen päällä usean sentin kerroksella jättäen myös runsasta pitsihuntua lasin reunoille. Kaunista. Tuoksu palvikinkkuinen, savuinen ja tervainen. Todella nautittava. Maultaan olut on savuinen, tervainen, hieman leipäinen ja loppupuoleltaan kuivattavan yrttisen ja mausteisen katkera. Melko pehmeä ja kermainen suutuntuma ja yleisote vallitsee ja luo toimivaa kontrastia lopun kuivan savuiseen ja pippurisen mausteiseen katkeroon. Helppoa juotavaa, suutuntuma menee osittain jopa, ei nyt sentään vetiseksi, mutta häviää kuitenkin varsin nopeasti.

Pours copper with a large head.
Nose shows bacon and cheese flavouring as well as sweet bready malt.
Flavour include more meaty smoke, bready notes and caramel. Delicious.

0.5l bottle. Copper color with lasting tanned head. Wonderful smoked aroma. Taste is smoked, like smoked bacon with some bitterness.Medium body and average carbonation. Overall its great smoked beer.

Appearance: hazy medium amber with one finger of creamy ivory head, excellent retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: hardwood smoke, caramel malt, savoury meat. (8/10) Taste: moderate smoke, moderate sweet, mild bitter. (8/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry smoky finish. (4/5)

Mmm... Bacon-y! A very pleasant, easy-drinking Rauchbier, with strong but not overwhelming smokiness. Im really starting to appreciate Rauchbiers in general and the Aecht Schlenkerla lineup more specifically, and this is quite a nice example. The smokiness in particular is very well implemented, and comes across more as bacon curing (i.e. hardwood) than campfire (i.e. softwood). In fact, this might be an excellent place for neophytes to begin exploring Rauchbiers, given the overall quite mellow character. (16/20)

This is a wonderful beer. Nice sized head with a strong aroma. The smoked taste really lasts in your mouth and pressures you to have another sip. This beer may not be for everyone but if you love different types of beers then I think you should try it. It pairs well in my opinion with Doritos Bold BBQ nacho chips or Ruffles Bacon & Sour Cream potato chips.

Cloudy brown color with minimal sized tan head. Aroma of bacon and some iron. Caramel taste, with not too smoked background, extremely well balanced and very drinkable. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very good. //bottle from Pivoteka

Bottled. Dark amber color with medium sized white/light brownish head. Quite malty with strong sweet barbecue ham smoke finish. Malty sweetness is dominant. Although it has nice aroma, I expected more flavors. So yea quite medium flavored smoked beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy brwon with a white head. Aroma of deep smoke, malty, light sausage, campfire, quite malty. Taste is smokey, malty, campfire, light bitter. Decent.
500ml bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a large head. Aroma is woody with smoked cheese. Taste has faint ham and cola to start. Woody, smoked ham finish.

Possibly the last of the wobbly men I will get to try unless I pick my arse up and get back to the bräu Heller-trum anytime soon. Alongside the rest this just is an absolute stand-alone pleasure to drink. It looks good, feels good, yields a heady waft and drinks like an elixir. Settles a ruby chestnut, misted by proteins in suspension. A lofty, off-white head gets comfortable atop and laces a feverish film of foam in its wake. Aroma? Absolutely amazing. Perfektionieren is the robust nose offering hints of Cheetohs and Burger Rings crisps, smoked bacon and peat-charred beef, bonfire smoke, spiced Biltong and a strange inkling of fresh made, salty tapenade. A little tart berries on the palate deepen the complexity yet simplicity of this beer. It is light and racy across the tongue. The aroma is just a plug for all that grips the olfactories on and in the swallow. Smoked meat, charcuterie, peat, ash and a good whack of green peppercorns (?) give it spice and substance to draw at the saliva glands and refresh the palate. Overall it is dry but drinks like a liquor the body simply needs. I loved this little gem. Another wobbly man to savour here on our shores in Oz. Lovely!!! (50cL, BBE 01/17, the Liquor Shed, Jandakot)
Bottle. Hazy, amber, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Aecht Schlenkerla Fastenbier has a thick, creamy, beige head, a semi-clear, amber appearance, with lots of powdery sediment, throughout, some splotchy lacing left on the glass, and visible bubble streams. Aroma is of smoked turkey or pork with a Busch Signature Copper Lager, under-note. Taste is of sweet, white bread, smoke, smoke, smoke, malt, low-level hop bitterness, and smoke. Mouthfeel is high-light (just like Busch Signature Copper Lager), and Aecht Schlenkerla Fastenbier finishes surprisingly crisp and not surprisingly smoky. RJT
500ml bottle. Hazy nutty brown colour with a foamy but shortlived off white head. Aroma is sweet smoke, flavour is barbecued meat, smoked ham with an underlying malty sweetness. Good
0,5l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier mit beiger Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Röstmalzen und Rauch, dies wird im Geschmack bestätigt. Süffig!

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Tap at Cask Republic. Straight outta Bamberg, crazy motha ... Anyway, this kicks ass. Smells like smoked bacon. Huge. Murky deep amber pour. White soapy head. Easy drinking. Brilliant.

Bottle, 9C at first which was far too cold but I didnt mind sniffing and sipping for a while as it opened up. Deep cloudy red with a large off white head that fades but laces well. Rich smoke and sticky bread crusts. Slight cheese as well as glazed ham Doesnt smell as sweet as the Marzen. Light bodied but with firm bready malt that comes though despite the big smoke. Likewise, peppery bitterness at the end shines though nicely. Quality.

Bottle. Lightly smoked aroma with some floral hints as well. Dark brown appearance with a frothy off-white head and good amount of carbonation. Lightly smoked flavour along with dark fruits and some citrus hoppy bitterness. Full bodied with a moderate bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Pours is clear amber, brownish with thick stable tan head. Aroma of smoked malts, smoked cheese, notes of dried fruits, plums, Taste has malty character with slightly smoky notes, light bitter with fruity aftertaste. Medium body, slick texture, light bitter finish.

Tra l'ambrato carico ed il marrone, limpida con riflessi dorati, schiuma beige chiara di buona persistenza.
Aroma prevalente di legno affumicato con note erbacee e lievissime note maltate.
Al palato sempre affumicato, malto d'orzo ed erbaceo, finale affumicato ed erbaceo, note legnose.
Corpo poco più che leggero, ben carbonata.

Bottle from World Beer Market. Pours a copper-brown with a big light beige foamy head that lasts. Massive smoked ham and bacon nose, much like the Cratz beer snacks they sell here. The taste reveals more caramel malt hinted at in the aroma, plenty of smoked meats. Its moderately fizzy, quite bitter up front, medium-bodied, a little chewy, lingering flavour.

A deep amber coloured beer with a thick head that stays quite a while. The aroma consists of fresh smoke with some sweetness in it. Tastewise the beer is almost perfect. Smoke, malts and some brown sugar. Finish is bitter, leaves a smoky taste in the mouth that lasts pretty long time. Maybe a little too much carbonation in my opinion.

Bottle at Craft Wine n Beer in Reno 
Clear dark amber with a small beige head, some lacing. Mild smokey and caramel. Taste is smokey and ham 
Nice, not overly smokey

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Bottle. Large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel, smokiness and some bacon. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel, some smokiness and bacon, light metal. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light caramel, some smokiness and bacon, light metal. Nice smoky one from Bamberg  notes of sharp metal in the finish, bit too much caramel. Nice head.
Bottle provided by Dedollewaitor, thanks buddy. Hazy light brown body with a medium offwhite head. Smoke, bonfire, caramel, ashy notes, malt, light hoppy. Lovely.

Bottle @ home. Pours a copper colored liquid with a tan head. Aroma of smoke, dark fruits and herbs with a sweet caramel backbone.Texture is smooth with smooth carbonation and medium body. Flavors of smoke, caramel, licorice root, leather, grass. Lingering smoke adn some red fruits. Balancing bitterness. My favorite Schlenkerla.

500ml bottle pours amber in color with a finger and a half of off-white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is smoke with caramel and grassy notes. Taste is a grassy hop bitterness with a caramel malty sweetness finishing with the smoke. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Overall, this is a good smoked brew that is worth checking out.

Keg BD Camden. Pours deep auburn, thin lacy head. Sweet barbecue nose. The smoke on the taste is obvious but not overwhelming. Some caramel and sweetness in the back. Like this a lot. Gives you nice smoky burps!

500ml brown bottle. Pours out clear and orange colour. Holds a fat column of tan head with very sticky edges, thick bands of lacing. Nose has delicious smoked meat/bacon. Taste has some malt sweetness with wood, smoke, meat. Late bitterness and grassy hop notes. Light bodied. Another great Schlenkerla brew.

On tap at The Hay Merchant. Pours a clear orange gold with large creamy white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is strong smoke and ash. Thin mouth, smoke, ash, fruity malt, wood, smoke overpowering, very good.

Bottle. 
Pours red brown. 
Very drinkable with a taste of leather, peat and some prune.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out super-carbonated. After it settles down a bit it looks pretty decent. A dark chestnut brown color with a inch thick light tan head. Aroma is fantastic. Super smoky! Texture is a bit fizzy, but flavor is deep and roasty with dry smoky notes throughout. Earthy-spice hoppy finish.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 16.9 oz. bottle poured into glass. Pours a murkyish brown, almost a cola color, with a thick khaki head. One of the fuller bodied heads that lingers for a tad too long. Smells of burnt chicory, smoked meat, and a fire pit, all with some sweet malt hiding in the back. Tastes of sweet caramel on the tongue, nice and malty. Then WHAM!! Holy shit it tastes like kielbasa. Meaty, fatty, smoke, garlic, pepper, finished with a maltiness left on the tongue. Very unique...odd but I oddly dig it.
Bottle. Dark Amber color. Malt and smoked ham in the aroma. Malty sweetish flavor. Full bodied. Smoked ham and beechwood in the flavor. Very well balanced. Great beer.

Ok this style is nothing for my taste. Aroma is smoked ham and nothing really else. Taste is more or less bitter and I think I am tasting salt. As a vegetarian for years I cant get around the ham aroma somehow. Very sad, that I dont like, what seems to be one of the best of its style.

Pours a hazy dark ruby/amber with a busy light tan head. Aroma is like walking into a smokehouse, along with some dark fruit. Taste is sweet caramel malt, buttered toasted biscuits, spices, smoked grain, prunes, and a little hop bitterness to round it out. Very interesting, chewy, delicious.

Tap @ mikkeller Aarhus. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma is obviously very smoked with notes of caramel malts and some grain in the background. Also some corn and a weak smoky cheesy note. The taste is sweet and smoky with notes of caramel, dark grains, corn, cheese and caramel. One of the better smoked beers I have had but this style is just not for me I guess.

Draft at Fountainhead in Chicago. The aroma in Neuskies Bacon. Bitter, smoky, ashy, woody, bacony, scotchy. Smoke rides into the far finish. Fantastic flavors, but one a decade would be enough for me.

Hazy, deep amber to brown colored with ruby hue, medium beige frothy head, nice lacing. Aroma is of some caramel, malt, moderate+ smoked ham and sausage aroma, some bread, light wood. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, caramel, smoked ham, bread with sausage, light+ bitterness, some light wood. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, oily to creamy. Excellent stuff, easy drinking and full of beautiful smoked meat flavor.
(bottle, Pivoteka Zagreb)
Clear brown towards ruby. Low head. Smoky aroma, raisin and apple. Smoky taste, some fruit and bitterness.
500 ml bottle. hazy brownruby body with a low head. Smoked meat, caramel, wood and fruit.

Keg at The Port Street Beer House, Manchester. A clear brown colour with a thick beige head. Aroma of smoked meat, smoked wood, some caramel, slight chocolate, a little nuts and subtle citrus in there. Taste of smoked meats, caramel, wood, some chocolate, slight nuts, a little dark fruits and subtle herbal, citrusy hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A long, dry, smoked and fruity bitterness in the finish. What a cracking smoked beer, similar to the marzen but lighter, fruitier with a subtle hop presence. Lovely.

appear red brown with a small frothy white head. Really smoky aroma, with hints of hay, and nuts. Taste light bitter, light sweet. medium bodied, with average carbonation. well balanced between smoke, sweetness, and bitterness.

Pours a slightly hazy amber color, topped with a fairly big white head, very creamy. Aroma of some wood and quite some bacon. Taste is sweet with some spicy feel, some woodiness. Bittery herbal feel. Not the best one I had, still drinkable.

Nut brown color with little foam. Smoked nose like smoked bacon. Delightful mild taste with a smokey bacon side. Malty smokey finish. This beer is less intense than the märzen, but much more balanced.

Draught at Mikkellerbar, Aarhus. Amber clear body and a small diminishing rocky head. Heavy aroma of smoke, some vanilla and caramel. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Long smoke finish, oily texture.
SB beställning, flaska. vilken fantastiskt rökt skinka arom. No 1. Skum att sitta på. Har allt. Arom smak body fyllighet. Ett mästerverk.

Not so easy to rate by appearance as it was served from tap in a ceramic mug. Head is slightly off-white, frothy and dense, persistent enough. When i get to see some liquid it looks dark red/light brown. In the aroma, a mild sweet dark fruity base (kinda bock-like) is overcome by notes of wood and ashes. In the taste, bread crust and caramel foundation, slight hint of dark fruits, again wood and ashes, the slightest hint of bitterness in the dry finish. While smoked notes prevailed in the aroma, the taste is perfectly balanced. Slight hint of what could be described as smoky fruitiness in the afterstaste. Light to medium body and carbonation, super smooth. Its very rich and complex and yet it goes down so easily. It doesnt get much better than this

Aroma - beechwood smoke and sweet malt.
Appearance - the body is a dark clean auburn, with good nucleation. The head is beige and well over 2+", the head is frothy and the retention is unparalleled.
Taste - rich dark beechwood smoke and some additional sweet malt. The taste can be described in some ways as a jerky meat like taste of the finest order.
Palate - body is between medium and full, texture is thick, average carbonation, slight astringency from the salted smoke.

Bottle at café brecht. Aroma of smoke, bacon, wood and roasted malt. Yeasty notes too. The flavour is medium bitter with a long bitter finish. The body is medium and the texture is oily. Soft carbonation.
Clear light Brown with a small white head. Aroma is smoke, bacon and malt. Taste is smoke, rubber and citrus

Bottle at Cafe Brecht. Its a hazy amber beer with a dense off white head. The aroma offers smoked sausage and caramel malts. Spiced smoked malty character with notes of smoked bacon and some fruity notes. Some wet firewood notes. Great.

Flasche, gekauft in Berlin. Jahrgang MMXVI. Nussbraune Farbe, klar, stabiler Schaum. Kräftige Raucharomen, Schinken, Sandelholz, Trockenfrüchte. Voller Körper, dabei aber leichter als das Original. Süffiger. Kräftiger, leicht herber Abgang. Sehr gut! 500. Rating!

Draft 0.25l at In De Wildeman Amsterdam Netherlands.17.03.2016.Taste with Potjebier.Pour it dark amost clear amber color with small white head.Aroma smoked not so agressive.Taste starts with smoked ham,continues with caramel,blueberry,finish with that sweet fruits.Nice smooth balanced.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus and from bottle. Dark bronze pour with a fluffy head. Notes of smoke (duh), sweet malts, some caramel, flesh and light woody.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Intensely smoked into, with lots of bacon and ham aroma. Less extreme on the tongue, but still very tasty. Highly drinkable without making sacrifices. Full-bodied and nourishing indeed!

Bottled 500ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Dark amber/brown coloured, medium sized tan head, distinct smoke in the nose. Roasted malt, smoked bacon, light caramel and wood with mild hoppy notes in rather smoked finish. Easy-drinkable and pleasant brew.

L:
-pours a clear copper with a big,foamy,offwhite head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-caramel,coffee,smoked bacon,bready,milky
T:
-bready,smoked bacon,woody,caramel
-medium to high bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Compared to the Märzen (its closest contemporary) the Fastenbier is more hoppy and less smokey.
Very good overall

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks tomer!! Clear dark brown with a white head. Bisli grill snack smokiness, even cranchos! Delicate bitterness, smoke, Bisli and malt in the mouth. Medium body, delicate (compared to Marzen) smoky finish. Pleasing.
Bottle. Copper color, off-white head. Sweet, smoky aroma. Fairly balanced flavor with smoke and balanced malts. Nice!

Clear deep nutty color with a fine thick off white head. Solid intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a fine carbonation. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. If you do not like peated beer. Never drink this. It is a quite heavy peated flavor. It destroys most of the other flavors. Ham and bacon. Solid breakfast.[Bottle from a trade with Nisse666]

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Fermentoren. Pours clear amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma is smokey, bacony, malty, hoppy. Taste is smoky, meaty, earthy, lighty hoppy, sweet malty. How people enjoy this so much is a beyond my comprehension haha
Draft at in de wildeman. Light hazy brown with an off white head. Aroma of big smoke, bacon, burnt malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

50cl bottle from our monopoly. Clear, dark brown / orange with a dense and handsome off-white head leaving laces. Intense, fat and baconish smoke aroma with a whiff of butter. Full-bodied with a solid malt base with some caramel. Lightly bitter finish with loads of smoke.

500ml bottle at home. Small creamy beige head. Aroma of smoked meat, light hoppiness, ash... notes of liquorice. Dry smokey bitter finish. Light to medium bitterness, medium to heavy bitterness. Really good with food... or by itself too.
Ruby red with off-white head. Campfire bacon, caramel and ash. Sweet, dry, ash and lingering coal finish. Overall: wow.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Bottle, fresh 2016 batch. Deep brown-amber color with a big creamy tan head that goes down rather quickly. Aroma is smoked wood, ham, salmon, some earthy hops, a delicate sweetness to it as well. Taste is light smoke and wood, some minerals, breadcrust, then a dry, slightly bitter finish, but not just hops, also not just burnt wood, there is an amazing balance between the two. The unfilteredness is noticeable in the mouthfeel, and there is some bready yeast character to it. The aftertaste is grassy and woody. This really is Brotzeit in a bottle. I have the feeling this is even more balanced than the Märzen, I maybe should try them in parallel. Nevertheless, this is a ridiculously good beer. 9-4-9-5-18 

Bottle, 2017 batch, freshly consumed on Ash Wednesday. My Smoked palate is much more refined now, I notice much more of the pale malts and earthiness as well as a touch of grassy hops. A real treat, can?t wait to have this from the wooden barrel this year.Wooden barrel at Schlenkerla. Less carbonation, more taste, perfect mouthfeel.

Eine Schönheit im Glas, stabiler Schaum, zügige Perligkeit, tolle Bernsteinfarbe. In der Nase die gewohnte Rauchnote mit leichter Süße, nicht zu derb. Im Trunk angenehme Rauchmalznoten, dann leicht bitter, wenn der Rauch schwindet. Wunderbar ausgewogen.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Reddish brown color with small beige head. Aroma of intense smoke, campfire, wood and notes of hops. Taste is smokey with pine and grass hops. Light carbonation. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Excellent and good smoke beer! Urbocks "little brother"

Hazelnut colour, off white head. Aroma of smoked ham, bread, hazelnuts, red apples and a bit of caramel. Light sweet, smoky aftertaste, with a bit of bacon flavour. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Pretty good

This is beer rating 5,000. I had the opportunity to go to Schlenkerla in April of 2013 and poured this beer into the glass I purchased from the brewery. I had been looking for this beer for several years prior to that holiday, and finally found it locally this spring. The appearance of this beer is excellent. It is an opaque brown color, with a lacing, off-white head. When held up to the light, it is a red color. Also of note is the lack of filtration, and the sediment and yeast can be seen in the beer. I like the aroma, lots of smoke, and while I usually do not jump to a description of roasted meat or bacon in rauchbier, I do pick up some of those aromas here. The taste cant be separated from the aroma. There is a lot of smoke of course; a light mineral character; dry malt and grain, and wood at the end. Aftertaste is lasting smoke and more dry malt. Full flavor and full palate, which no doubt benefits from the lack of filtration. I do not throw perfect scores out, but this beer was everything I hoped for, therefore it is called for here. Rauchbier has come to be one of my favorite styles, and it is going to be a challenge to find one better than this.

Sweet malty aroma that is quite peaty.
Aroma is sweet and light smoky.
Light body, low carbonation, dry.
Herbal bitter after taste.
Not as good as the other offerings from Heller.

Pours a pretty clear chestnut with big light-khaki head. The usual charcuterie scents dominates the nose. Smoked ham, smoked sausages, a hint of damp wood smoke, wet moss, a hint of hay, some assorted grains and semi-dark chocolate in the background. Light to medium bodied, dry palate. Quite muted flavours. Ends on a dry, slightly spicy, herbal and ashy note on the shortish finish. I prefer the normal Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smoked meat, charcoal and smoke smell. Slightly smoky flavor, which makes it easy to drink. OK bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Good in the beginning, but you lose the urge for a while. Smaller bottle thanks! Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

caramel, bread, hay, smoke, woody, brown, black, hazy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 
A bit more smoother and more body than rauchbier märzen and not as heavy on the smoke. Excellent

Flasche. 0,5l. Braun, klar. Feiner Schaum, beige. Duft nach Geräuchertem, vielleicht holzig. Kräftiger holzig-rauchiger Geschmack im Vordergrund. Trockenes Mundgefühl, sehr leichte Süße und runde Bitterkeit. Harmonisch. Absoluter Hammer!

On tap at the Moth. Been looking for this one for a while. Pours a brilliant reddish orange color with a yeasty taupe colored head. Notes of smoked ham, cooking oil, olive tapenade, and faint brown sugar. Cant drink much of this stuff.

0,5L Bottle from Hopfen And Malz, Berlin - Pours a light, hazy brown color. Aroma of smoked meats, campfire and a slight toffee-ish malty aroma. The flavor has a blend of smoke, chocolate and rye bread with a slight herbal/spicy finish to it. This is a well made beer, and it shows. The smoke is perfectly balanced with the sweet and malty notes.
Dark amber body, medium to thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Smoke, brisket, biscuit, grass, and toffee. Medium bodied with soft carbonation, mild sweetness, lingering smoky finish.
Pours cloudy deep mahogany with low light tan head. Aroma of smoke, burnt wood, german sausage. Taste is sweet, burnt and smoky yet nicely balanced. Sweet, medium body with soft carbonation.

500ml bottle, many thanks to Finn. Pours a two-finger beige head slowly fading over a slightly cloudy copper coloured body with a shade of dark red. Nice lacework. Bacon up front to the nose, earth and chocolate malts behind. Well blended taste of smoked and dark malts. Salt, bitter and sweet ending. Perfect with the meat soup. Very nice (Tromsø 08.05.2015).

Brun-orange-röd med ett ljust brun-orange skum. Doft: Rökt korv, fresh doft brinnande trä, sot, fresh höst luft. Smak: Som doft + bröd, linfrön, humle, frukt. Jäkligt gott, låt den bara inte bli för rumstempererad. Ölen intas till minne av farmor. Öppnades ungefär då hon dog, stod öppnad i sovrummet när jag meddelades av pappa. Drickes i sorg.

500ml brown bottle with a purple cap, poured into a snifter glass. Appearance is hazy brown with a large frothy tan head that reduced slowly. Aroma of roasted malts and smoked and cured charcuteries. Flavours of peat, smoked and cured charcuteries, dark bread, raisins and a hint of orange zest and caramel. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall a great smoked beer at a reasonable price, would have liked it even a bit more stronger and smokier.
0.5l bottle. Hazy dark amber body, off-white head. Aroma of smoked ham and bread with a minimal fruityness. Taste of smoke, toast, caramel and floral hops. Awesome beer.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Reall good classy Schlenkerla what else. A nice addition to the bottled options. Not as BOOM smoked ham as some of the others, however the smoky malt is still the main event here as well. A nice mid level smoked beer. 2015 edition. From Hopfen and Malz in Berlin.
Lt tan-amber. A-smoke-slight bacon, some med malt. T-sweet med malt-some caramel and smoke hit initially, finish is earthy hops, some yeast.

Bottle, traded with McTapps and MichaelAwesome, thanks! A very clean, meaty, smoked profile, without the caramelly notes that are found in the other Schlenkerla beers (with the exception of the weizen, of course). Also a sweet note, reminiscent of incense and smoked plums. Again, a clean flavour profile, soft mouthfeel and a formidable bitterness. Lots and lots of meaty, fatty smoke. You can feel the wood the smoke originated from at all times. A beer complete in itself.
Flaske 500ml fra Alko Muonio. Mahognyfarget. Veldig høyt skum som daler sakte. Nydelige kniplingsfiligranser. Utmerket baconaroma. Smaken også bacon med lite annet. Bra - men uvariert.

Bottle: Shaker:
Big creamy beige head.
Clear copper orange.
Aroma is beautiful smokey with leather, banana, snoked/burned branches, light meat tone.
Flavour is more bitter and even refreshing than smokey as I expected it to be smokey. Also more (bitter) green/herbal tones. 
Aftertaste is also green/herbal (bitter) with malts and bitters... Very light light smokey tint in the far back.
Low carbo, light watery lighter creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
I like the other beers from this brewery better!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: So, I guess Im just another dude drinking a fastenbier during the Easter season. This has been one of my "bucket list" beers for quite awhile, and while Id love to try this from gravity one day in Bamberg, this will have to do for now. Aroma: Has that peat intensive, campfire-like nose that you expect from this kind of beer. The level of smoke is comparable to the Urbock, and also has some light savory bacon notes as well. Appearance: Murky dark brown pour with a mountain of bone head that settles into a thick cap. Flavor: Smokey, peated intensity up front that gives way to spiced caramel bread, which comes off as more spicy toward the finish, which is pretty dry. Palate: Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: This did not disappoint; if you are a smoked beer fan, and can get your hands on this, youre in for a treat. Then again, if youre a smoked beer fan, you were probably already seeking this beer anyway.

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a moderately lasting off white head. Really smokey aroma, wood, molasses, meaty. Taste is of more smoke, some pine notes, caramel. Oily texture, full bodied, medium carbonation. Lovely

Der Rauchgeruch ist typisch für Schlenkerla: intensiv und deutlich nach Schinken, sowie im Hintergrund etwas nach Wacholder. Der Rauchgescmack ist dann auch relativ vordringlich, aer ausgewogen und lecker. Den Geschmack nach Schinken behält man noch einige Minuten am hinteren Gaumen.
Geruch natürlich rauchig. Im Geschmack gut restsüß, aber sonst leer. Kaum Hopfen. Aber sehr süffig.

Bottle. Thanks to KL.Signature smoke, so much richer than most other smoked beers, somewhat dank in the nose, as well. Glowing copper brown color. Thin malty initial flavor, with the smoke leading the way. Near tart-like bittering. A floating finish. Thin body, a bit watery. Gentler smoke than in the regular one. Smooth and pleasant.

500 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Wonderful deep dark amber/light copper, perfectly clear, with a nice, fluffy, forever lasting off white head. The nose is dominated by smokey and meaty notes, not too over the top, but certainly very much present. A hint of smoked Provola and some generic toffee/caramel presence. Taste pretty much follow suite, I was expecting a more extreme/complex beer, but its quite simple even if still dynamic. Chestnut honey like sweetness, super high drinkability, lingering toasted and campfire smoke taste with some fried bacon reminiscence. It does get slightly cloying toward the end, but I find it an acceptable and minor detail. Soft carbonation, light to medium body, slightly oily texture. Nice indeed.

A clear dark ambeer beer with lots of small particles floating around. Nose is smoky with notes of beech, bacon and peat. Taste is rich, mildly sweet and with a dry, mong finish. Medium carbonation and rich, balanced body. Very nice and well balanced, best smoked beer i tried so far.

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, Saturday 2nd May 2015 in company of Jackie and Simon   Dark, Dark brown with a ruby glint, really smokey but fresh and really full flavoured, the smokey sausage is great but certainly not to intrusive. Great stuff. A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

On tap@ Wildeman. Finally, I got this one. :-) The aroma has caramel malt, strong and pretty bacon German smoke and some grassy hops. Clear, amber coloured beer with a thin off white head. The taste is light sweet, has bacon, caramel, grassy hops. Bit sticky palate. Good stuff.

Tap @ In de Wildeman, medium sample. Almost clear copper color, short frothy head. Aroma of smoke, earthy and grassy hop, quite some caramel and toffee. Like a smoked alt. Soft bitterness, soft smokeyness. Not as smoked as other schlenkerlas, but combined with wonderful caramel and slight hoppiness. Good stuff.

500ml. its been ages since Ive had a rauchbier from Aecht , and Ive never had this one before . The nose straight away reminds you of the relentless smoky nuance that their beers showcase ...bacon, burnt wood , dry malt , oil - All pretty grate as aromas go . Poured into a German jug , deep amber/brown ,with beige foam that lasts ages . Ok , there is a bitter woodiness that is dry on the finish , kinda salty , complements the meaty texture. This does everything you would expect from this brewery . Gud textbook rauchber .

Pours a rich, reddish brown with a loud and foamy tan head that hangs out awhile. Aroma is a wonderful smoky campfire that evokes smoked meats. Quite active on the tongue and a medium mouthfeel. Taste is a pleasant smoke riding bready malts and culminating in noble hops and a lingering smoky bitterness. If you like rauchbiers, this is a beauty. I enjoy and appreciate the style. Burpalicious too!

Bottle at home, 26th April 15, bought in Berlin, at Hopfen and Malz, described by Ludgar as the precious liquid. Germanys number one, smoked beer, pours dark clear brown, aroma is meaty smoked bacon, ash, bonfire. Taste is smokey smooth, burnt, bacon. Really pleasant and very drinkable

Bottle @Fermenteam tasting! Thanks to Lukasmh! Aroma has lots of smooth smoke, sweet fruit notes like ripe plums and banana. Slight hops. Taste is very dry with some meaty smoke, slight leather. Very smooth. Slight bitterness. Medium carbonation and soft body!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Nose is lovely. Smoked cheese, bacon, wood fire, sweet bacon. Taste is sweet smoke, bacon, cold meats, cheese, dried fruits, lots of the wood and bacon. Savoury beers are such a treat. 
Mouthfeel is
Bottle - Wonderful sweet smoke and some bacon notes. Clear copper with a rich beige head. Light oak, smoke and creamy caramel with a rich texture. Finish has some fruity sweet notes

[2015-03-22] Väriltään tummanruskea, lähes musta. Tiheä vaahto. Tuoksussa savua ja joulukinkkua. Maussa joulukinkkua, savua ja salmiakkia. Sopivasti humalaa, joka tukee keskitäyteläistä runkoa. Hiilihappja melko paljon; hyvä suutuntuma.
Bottle 0.5l from Alko, Vantaa. BBE 11/2015. Colour is brown with small foamy white head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, some caramel, hints of tar, some sweetness and malts.

500ml bottle at home. Dark copper brown color with nice light beige head. Aroma is smoked, bacon, caramel malty, wood. Taste is light sweet and bitter, smoked bacon, wood notes and caramel again. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from St Albans beer shop, St Albans, Herts. A dark amber/brown coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Smokey, malty aroma. Tastes smokey, malty, caramel, meaty, slight bitterness. Decent smoked beer.

13th April 2015Kings Head. Keg. Clear amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is airy with good fine carbonation. Smoked kipper nose transfers to the flavour. Light malts. trace of caramel sweetness. Strong carbonated nip in the finish. Fresh and nicely smoked.
Bottle. Red brown pour, with a caramel colored head. Smoke, caramel, smoked bacon, grassy, and some dried fruit. Quite good, I could drink more of this.

Keg, Brewdog, Leicester. Amber, brown with an off white foam. Aromas are smoky bacon with toasted malts and nutty aspects. Grainy with background toffee and sudsy notes. Flavours are weetabix and sticky toffee malts with smoked ham. Earthy and peppery with weetabix and light, soapy pine. Dry nuttiness with a spicy finish. Good to have this available.

Appearance: clear ruby brown with beige head.
Aroma: smoked ham.
Taste: smoked ham, light bitter.
Palate: dry and refreshing, full bodied, light carbonation.
Overall: very nice.
Ruby red colour with beige head. Smoky meaty aroma. Taste of bacon, with a sweet malty background.
On tap at the moth, muddy brown color with some soapy foam, smoky wet wood aroma ,flavor is good smoke , wood char, meaty pork , reminds you of the little dog beers, mild finish, glad I got to try it
drat at meddlesome moth; couldnt get aroma in restaurant. slight smoke in flavor but nothing stood out to me; just a beer.....

Bottle thanks to richthevillan. A beer that has been on my hit list since day one of ratebeer. Chestnut beer with medium head and decent head. Aroma of bacon and smoked. Taste is malts, smoked bacon and meat. Medium bodied. Excellent.
