text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines shared with Sarkynorthener; dark copper pour with a big frothy beige head, aroma has smoked gammon, taste has frazzles, quite meaty, not a bad smoked.

On tap at Brauhaus Schmitz in Philly. Dark ruby red color. Small beige head. Wonderful smoked malt aroma, redolent of oak and burnt caramel. Flavor is more of the same. Sweet smoky malt with dark caramel and oaky notes. Spicy hops in finish. Very earthy and flavorful. Delicious!
Bottle at Petes wedding. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is smoky sausage, taste is dry, smoked, toffee, sweet.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, smoke, smoked meat, some fruitiness, grass and hint of floral. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long malty, smoked and light grassy finish. Body is medium, texture is oiiy, carbonation is soft.

Aroma has sweet caramel malts and oak smoke. Very nice smoked meat aroma. Pours dark reddish brown with a small head that leaves beautiful lacing. Taste has light sweetness, smoked meat and ash. Very malty. Full bodied with average carbonation. Overall a very, very good smoked beer.

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Leicht trüb, haselnuß with small beige head. Roasted bacon in nose and flavour, beef jerky finish. Balanced and light. Very good.

Bottle. Surprised they started bottling this. Copper/brown pour with a small thick head that fades to a ring. Aroma is all smoked ham and bacon. Very cool. Tastes the same really. All smoked pork with just maybe a hint of campfire in the finish. Pretty neat beer but I think I was expecting more.
Aroma is a chimney in the wintertime. Taste is an amber beer with a hint of smoked sausage.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2017 Black brown colour. Smell of a smoke, roasted malts. Taste is for me unusual, namely I need almost half a bottle to get used of it. But is still strange for me because of strong presence of smoked pork in aftertaste. But technicaly masterpiece.

Pours unclear dark caramel amber with a nice beige head. Aroma is so smooth, bringing some barbecue, tobacco and sebago docksider, and pig. The flavor brings some smoky barbecue, not burnt or roasted at all, with some woody campfire notes and a smooth body that allows it to be so easy on the palate to drink. You can tell how pure it is in the creamy body.

Got the Chimay glass out today, so why not? This beer is as close as a vegetarian like myself gets to eating a bratwurst... very meaty aroma and taste indeed. Not my favorite style at all, but I would bet that this is the ultimate example.

Keg at Our Black Heart, Camden. Mid- to dark brown, translucent. Caramel and oak smoke dominate the light aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity, with almost a Christmas cake note. Finishes more bitter with a smoky aftertaste. Extremely good.

16.9 oz bottle. Clear brown with a spongy beige head. Nose is smoked sausage, light malt and wood. Creamy medium body with a lingering buzz; kind of refreshing. Taste is plum, cola, faint wood and hints of smoke. Highly drinkable with perfect smokiness.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours slightly hazy brown. Aroma is meaty, mostly smoked ham and salami. Taste is smoky, less meaty than nose but still smoked ham. Bready malts and hops as well and good balance, however, I still cannot get much more than smoke related notes in these smoked beers.

Dark brown beer with a huge beige foam. Very strong smoky aroma. A bit watery body. Nice balanced bitterness and sweetness. Quite strong hops for this kind of a beer. A really good one. Easy to drink yet very tasty.
Lovely unexpected treat on draft in Brewdog Liverpool , rounded flavours not overpowered by the smokiness. Cant wait for our summer trip to Bamberg
Delicate smoked aroma, plus salami. Flavor starts sweet, more smoke, moderate bitter finish.

Bottle. Nose is that beautiful house smoke, meaty meat character (snobbiest of snobs be damned, there is definite ham association). Poured into a Willybecher and the beautiful ruby-garnet color is almost enough to bring a tear to my eye (even picking up purple hues); large and dense/rocky beige head, lace. Dry body and digestible, light-medium smoke resolving to light astringency, hops more in the Schaumkrone but also in the finish; light-medium body with medium bitterness and meaty smoke, though it doesnt take long to acclimate. Mild Munich / toasted bread crust, but lasting. The gut first impression is that this is less malty / more stratified than usual, but its still a good one, and much more "adult."

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 @ Oluthuone Kuikka, Helsinki, from an oak barrel. Pours reddish brown with a very little white head. The aroma features a typical assortment of smoky ham, bread, peat and tar ? very solid and rich. Taste is light to medium sweet, very malty and smoky; flavours of ham and bread initially, later tar and wood, also a touch of whiskey. The palate is medium to full bodied, velvety smooth and very low in carbonation; smoother and richer in taste than the bottled version. Rich, smoky flavour with ham and peat.

500mL bottle, pours a deep dark brown with a small beige head. Nose is wonderfully smoky, with ashpit and smoky fire pit. Flavour is complex, with dry smoky bready malts dominating. Not too ashy or burnt. Everything is perfectly balanced. Excellent beer.

Smell of smoke, peat. Deep bronze colour, mid-brown head. Aroma of smoke, oak, finishes with hop and roasted malt. Also a faint of pepper to be noted. Half-soft carbon, slightly oily texture.Very nicely balanced, albeit slightly watery.
500 mL bottle into a pint glass. Delivery from Schlenkerla website. Lovely smoked cheese aroma. Smooth smokiness, woody and well balanced. Easily one of the best smoked beers you can find.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker. Dark brown colour, foam disappears quickly. Malty with notes of bread. Light sweet notes. Smoky aftertaste with hints of bacon. Very well balanced and very easy drinkable. Very good!
.5l bottle from Alko JKL Pours clear copper with high thick offwhite head. Aroma is wooden bon fire smoke, smoked pork, dark malts, dark bread. Flavor is mostly same. Great smoking good beer!

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 Bottle. Pours a beautiful clear amber, lively carbonation and nice thick and lasting off-white light beige head. Aroma is smoke at first. Light smoked bacon, wood, dark malts and subtle earthy hops. Taste is light sweet, smoke, caramel, malts, bready. Medium well carbonated body. Finish is light bitter and crisp with dry smoke. Really really well balanced and sessionable!

50 CL BOTTLE from the cave Glasgow
 Aroma is smoky like when you come back from a bonfire
 Taste is mild smoke not as much as the normal Schlenkerla with a acidic bitter finis
 overall a nice beer
From tap at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of smoke, oak, bacon, malt, caramel and some bitterness.
Pours reddish brown. Taste of smoke and malts. Grass and oak, a little bit roasty taste. This one is so delicious, absolutely love this taste of smoke it has.

Complex strong smoke aroma. Appearance is a cloudy brown with a nice sized head and good lacing. Flavor has complex, smooth smoke character with notes of toast and some malty sweetness. Mouthfeel medium light with medium carbonation. Overall, this a great session smoke beer. The smoke character is strong, but really smooth. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: beacon, savoury, smoked flavours. Appearance: clear, dark brown, medium, creamy, slightly beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: grain malts, smoked and savoury favours intensify, light sweet, light bitter, light carbonation. Overall: excellent Smoked, however, not sure how this one scores so much higher than the Schlenkerla Bocks. Bottle from BrewDog, Shepherds Bush.
Pyöräkadulla 3/2015. Very good beer, well balanced and interesting. A bit lighter than Urbock or Doppelbock, still very satisfying.
290315. Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with a nice head. Aroma smoke, malts. Nice smoky after taste. Very well balanced. Not Bad.

Bottle at home, thanks to Bropey for picking up, 28/03/15.
Vibrant chestnut brown with a big old light beige covering that stays to make chat - shes a looker!
Nose is smoked malt, toasted nuts, toffee, oaky wood, dark fruit rinds, ashen tones.
Taste comprises burnt biscuits, smoked malt, birchwood, raisens, charr, Frazzles, light cocoa, toffee, dried fruit.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, mellow smoked tones in the close.
World class smoked beer, could session on this, drinkability is very high.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 0,5l bottle from Alko Jyväskylä. Pours deep chestnut with a medium off-white head. Aroma is malts and smoked ham. Flavor is malts, smoked ham and some hops. Great, as usual.

500ml bottle BB Dec 2015, 5.5%.  Very dark orange / brown amber, big foamy cratered beige head, light lacing.  Aroma is fried bacon, frazzles, smoked sausage.  Theres also a fruitiness.  Background metal. Body is medium, slightly foamy, tingly carbonation.  Taste is smoke, ash, lager malts, wood, salty.  Finishes dry. Long musty aftertaste.  Refreshing yet complex.  So drinkable.

On tap at Ølbaren. Cloudy dark amber with a medium beige head. Heavy smell of smoked bacon already from a distance. Aroma likewise, like a heavy fatty dish of smoked ham, smoked sausages slow-cooked in beans. The taste is dry, slightly hoppy once the smoke subsides. The palate is greasy. Long smoked aftertaste. Full bodied, filling, a perfect replacement of a heavy sauerkraut on a fasting day. Unfortunately it does not really make it drinkable. Interesting and very well dona and balanced nonetheless.

Pours an dark ruby red with an brown eggshell head. Aroma is dominated by cured meat, bacon and other smoked foods of a similar nature. Taste is smokey, slight hop bitterness and a sweetishly pleasing finish.

Bottle: The aroma is heavy smoked ham and bacon...and its awesome! Maybe there is some faint caramel there too, but the smoked meat absolutely dominates. It pours a dark mostly transparent brownish-orange with a two finger beige head that fades to a thick film. There is a good amount of soapy webbing and rings left of the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of light-moderate caramel and maple. The finish has moderate smoked maple glazed ham, light bacon, and very faint campfire. Its medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, this is the best Smoked beer Ive ever had.
Bottle. Clear deep amber color with a thick foamy off-white head. Strong, smoky aroma with notes of sausage, peat and tar. Mostly dry, smoky taste. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu lasiin mahinginruskeana ja kirkkaana, muhkealla kolmen sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa vahvimpana on Schlenkerlan tuttua savukinkkua, jonka lisänä on yrttinen mausteisuus ja pureskeltava viljaisuus. Jopa lievää mentholmaisuutta on havaittavissa. Maussa on myös savukinkkua, muttei niin vahvana kuin tuoksussa. Raikas hedelmäinen ja yrttinen humalointi tuo selvää raikkautta, pureskeltava viljaisuus taas parantaa juotavuutta entisestään. Suutuntuma on suht napakasti humaloitu, mutta savuisuudesta huolimatta hieman turhan kevyt. Ei kuitenkaan vetinen missään nimessä. Vaikken tyylistä pidäkään niin kovin, niin tämä on kyllä todella hyvä olut. Savuoluiden aatelia.

Bottle shared with All my vinyl thanks to Ash. For the purpose of introducing the uninitiated to smoky bacon like brews this is clearly as pronounced as you can get without potentially putting them off for life. Looks good; dark dark amber with a good head. Smoky malty aromas, smoky malty brown sugar rounded sweetness. Easy drinking. Arguably one of the most balanced smoked beers out there - not too little ( only in name smokiness, as in many gimmick beers) , and not too much. They got it spot-on with this one. A 4d smoked beer. Totally Gallus !
Bottle shared thanks to Ashton McCobb, shared with jeevan. Pours clear red-brown, thick off-white head. Aromas of smoke, treacle. Taste is smoky, oaky, toasted malt. Softly sweet finish.
These Aecht beers are always very smoke but their smoke always has a huge palate. While its not exactly my thing, this is very complex. Light bitter smoke finish. Pours maroon. Tap at Churchkey.

Bottle from Appellation Wines Comely Bank. 
Appearance - deep amber with a red chink and a nice lacy head. 
Nose - a mixture of stewed apples and smoke. 
Taste - more of the same. Complex and balanced. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy yet dry smoky texture and a long balanced dry finish. 
Overall - my favourite from Schlenkerla. Plenty of fruitiness which holds the smokiness in balance.
smoked aroma,brown, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice smoked finish.

Deep mahogany with ruby, light brown big frothy head, sticky lacing. Looks good. Pure delicate smoky aroma, bit tar and salt, malty, lightly bitter, salty licorice, nice. Medium to full body, long smoky finish, dry and medium roasted, not burned, carbonation balances. Excellent smokiness, tasty, looks great, good stuff!

Keg at the Rake. It pours clear deep brown with a thick light tan head. The nose is rich, woody, juicy, smoke, bacon frazzles, smoked meats, bonfire, dried fruits and honey glaze. The taste is bitter, earthy, rich smoke, pine, maple glazed bacon, leather, resin, honey, toasty brown sugar, raisin, date and a touch of spice with a dry, firm finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Wow. Good depth and great drinkability. Smoke is of course a big part of this, but does not dominate the beer. A smokey masterpiece.

500 ml bottle into pine glass; no bottle dating, but is a recent release. Pours lightly cloudy deep ruby red color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of huge wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown bread, brown sugar, light char, herbal, pepper, light pine, and herbal/smokey earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready/smoked malt and earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, light char, herbal, pepper, light pine, and herbal/smokey earthiness. Fair amount of herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of wood smoke, caramel, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, light char, herbal, pepper, light pine, and herbal/smokey earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/smoked malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavor with zero yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and slightly creamy/sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome hoppy Rauchbier style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/smoked malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

500 ml bottle
Clear mahogany to amber colored beer with big blonde head. Aroma has milk chocolate, toffee, smoked wood and smoked ham. Flavor has fruits, grassy bitterness and smoke. Palate is thinner than medium with quite heavy carbonation and some bitterness. Finish has only mild bitterness. Aftertaste is licoricy, fruity, dark bready, herbal and of course smokey. Very smooth, well balanced, very drinkable. My favourite smoked beer so far.
Pours dark amber with off-white head. Aroma of smoked meat. Taste is similar with malty sweetness. Pass the brisket!

Bottle. Dark brown and reddish color with a small light brown head. Aroma has smoke, caramel and syrup. Taste is first a bit sweet but ends with a malty and quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, roasted malt, smoke, hops and ash.
Pours brown with tan head. Aroma is smoke and roasted. Flavour is smoky, roasted and light to medium bitter.

At the Franken Bier Fest in Rome-Italy, in tap with mortlach. Pours brown amber color, pretty clear with a semi filtered appearance and a medium ivory head going brown. Nose: speck ham, fontina cheese, smoked. Mouth: medium-low carbonation, smoked cheese, malts. A gem. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 50 cl. Pours black dark mahogany with frothy head and a smokey scent. Notes of smoke, malts, hops, caramel, chocolate, bread, nuts, wood. Really easy drinkable with plenty of taste.

Bottle. Pours a reddish amber with a stylish, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is smoke, smoked ham, some bready maltiness. Taste is a lot of smoke, light smoked ham, some grass, dark malt breadiness, some tar. Light with decent carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 50 cl, bottled. Pours slightly cloudy red with a pleasant beige head. Aroma: Smoke, wood. Taste: Pleasantly moderately sweet, nice smoke flavours. Malty flavours, some hoppy bitterness. Hints of medicinal tones. Berries, and tervapastilli. Palate: Medium-full body, noticeable but balanced carbonation. Very nice, strong smoke aroma, yet balanced. 
-----
3.3.2016: No score changes. Strong smoked ham, pleasant malty tones, bread dough. Excellent.

Keg at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Clear brown with a medium sized good lasting and lacing tan head. Meaty salami smoke in the nose. Medium/full body, soft carbonation, creamy and soft texture. Lots of meaty smoke, wood, light caramel, faint fruity notes and some hay and earth. Filling sweetness with subtile bitterness. Long meaty smoke in the finish. I can still taste it half an hour later. Very fine beer.
Aika mukava ensimmäinen pääsiäisolut. Tuo savuntuoksu on aina paikallaan. Vähintään ohut ehkä kuitenkin.

Clear reddish brown colour, white head. Smoky aroma, malts, bacon, caramel, red fruit. Smoky sweet flavour, bread, straw, light nuts and vanilla. Finish vanilla, caramel, ash, malts. Schlenkerla never disappoints.(from 50cL bottle @ home)

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Cask.extremely smooth and fresh nurturing feeling. The smoke a bit mellower, allowing better drinkability. Upping thents a lot.Old: 3.5. Bottle. Dark red, brown, clear. Strong smoked ham, bambergian malts. Some plums, dark fruityness. Med bodied, quite nice balance. Spicy dark plummy smokey flavour. A softer, more dark fruitier schlenkerla. Nice. That smokyness is always something I enjoy.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

500 ml bottle. Dark reddish brown colour, off-white head. Smoky aroma with sweetish malts and woody notes. Toasted flavour of smoked ham and sweet malt. The finish is dryish, with moderate bitterness and tar notes. Tasty, but Eiche is still my favourite Schlenkerla.

0,5 l bottle from Schlenkerla webshop, best before end 8/2015. Clear, dark reddish amber with a small, soapy, slowly diminishing, off-white head, leaving not many lacings on the glass. Pleasant, smokey aroma of smoked ham, campfire and ash. Sweetish, malty taste of smoked ham, campfire and ash with hints of caramel and raisins. Persistent, smokey aftertaste with a minimally metallic note. Medium to full body, foamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very aromatic and tasty but I expected a bit more. Wouldnt say it is the best one from Schlenkerla. Still way above German standards.

Really cool that the is finally bottled! Pours hazy red-hazel, large creamy off-white head that does dissipate but leaves a lot of residual, and good, if clumpy, lacing on the glass. Aroma is smoky, ash char, campfire, some caramel and bread. Flavor is light sweet and a light bitterness, smokiness apparent but certainly not overpowering. Malty and smoky in equal parts. Medium light body, high carbonation, soft mouthfeel. Tasty.
Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with smoke, peat, malts, toffee, toast, wood and a bit of grass. Bitter finish with smoke, peat, toffee and toast. Excellent smoked beer.
Bottle 50cl from Alko. Pours clear mahogany with a beige head. Smoky, malty, smooth aroma. Smoky, malty caramel, some wood notes in the flavor.
50cl bottle. Aroma is sharp smoke and fruits. Pours dark brown with reddish hue and small thin head. Taste is warm, smoke and oak with smooth hops and long after taste. Yummy!

A dark brown, slighty red, a head is medium and blond. Aroma is smokey but its balanced and quite dry, some tar liquirice candies, low sweetness, enjoyable. Taste has smoke, malts, only hint of tar liquirice candies, some bitterness in the end. Medium bodied, quite smooth carbonation. Not intensive as Urbock but this has its own strenghts. Lighter and dryer, surprisingly fresh and drinkable. Tastefull smoke is dominating.

Shared by jfb at Braukunst Live, Munich, many thanks! dark red filtered color, small white head. smells smoky, bacon. medium to full body, big bacon taste, malty sweetness, bubbly, creamy, light cheesy, bacon dry finish.

Poured form bottle into lager glass a nice bottle brown with plenty of off white head and lace. Aroma is of a pork smokehouse but a little more subdued compared to the Marzen. Smoke and bacon are the notes here in the aroma and the taste. Creamy but outdoors like sitting next to a campfire. I like this one a little better than the fantastic Marzen most likely because its a little more subduded. Also reminds me of Chinese Lapsang Souhong tea, which is smoked over fire to dry. Wonderful.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Chestnut-colored with little light passing through. The nose is a fascinating interplay of starch and smoke: bacon, roasted green peas, crispy noodle snack, BBQ pork skins, some cereal, roasted barley, and beechwood. Theres a beautiful malty, caramely sweetness throughout keeping the smokiness in check. Beautiful and appetizing. The mouthfeel is silky, with a medium-to-thin body. The CO2 is subtle, but grows much in vigor if you push it. The taste is woody, smoky bitter with an umami edge and more than nominal sweetness. Lovely, top-notch.

Vielen Dank an Erzengel für dieses Bier! Klare orangebraune Farbe, ordentliche beige Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr rauchig, holzig, Schinken. Geschmack röstmalzig, süß rauchig, Schinken, etwas Holz, Karamell, sehr köstlich.

Bottle. An almost clear one, brown in color, with a dense, light beige head on top. The aroma is pleasantly smoked, ham-like, with dark caramel, some dried fruits and with a fruity touch. Piney hints in the far back. Its very soft on the palate, full-bodied and semi-dry. Ham, smoke, caramel and dried fruits in the flavor, with a faint touch of bitterness. Not unbalanced or sweetish in any way. Lasting finish with the bitterness more evident. Sure a nice one, easy drinkable, tasteful and very soft on the palate. Went very well with the lunch we had. Would sure like more of this. 150228

Many thanks to Gabriel and John!!! Pours a clear dark cola cool with a rich, light tan head. The smell is heavy bacon, smoked and roasted malt, some malt sweetness. The taste is caramel, roast, smoke ending dry with some fruit. The body is light with fine beautiful carbonation.

500ml bottle [avowedly two, therefrom the first for "lart pour lart", flippant, pure enjoyment]. Clear, deep copper colour with late awakening, average, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, superbly lacing, off-white to beige head. Well-known, world-famous, Schlenkerla smoke aroma, this time without sweet-ish touch, smoked trout, lentil soup/stew (Linseneintopf), ham (Schwarzwälder Schinken), campfire, beechwood ashes, etc. pp. Taste is dry, smoked malty, herbal, somehow the Linseneintopf (selbstverständlich mit Speck- und Wursteinlage)-association accumulates to a fixed idea (without claiming Linseneintopf to be a typical Bavarian "Brotzeit", but it is definitely included, accepted); add any of your personal, IDIOSYNCRATIC associations concerning smoke, all of them will prove to be true. Soft, minimally sticky palate, excellent carbonation. All the stops pulled out, perfect harmonious interaction. Terrific!

Na, dass ich vonnem Rauchbier nicht angeekelt bin, das ist schon mal ein großes Plus. Gut, das Raucharoma ist ekelhaft und dominierend, aber der Geschmack entpuppt sich bisweilen als süffig, mild, leicht im Hopfen und einer milden, sehr süffigen Form mit ausbalancierter Perlung. Recht "lecker", könnte man sagen, wenn nicht der Lachs in der Nase wäre.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a light clear dark brown-ruby colour with a low head and medium body. Aroma of smoked bread and malt. Taste of roasted sweet malt, roasted ham, smoked bread and mild fruits. Smokey-sweet finish with hints of smoked cheese.

500ml bottle.  Nice slightly smokey nose. The beer starts smooth malty with a nice and not too intense layer of smoke. Nice smooth malty body. Moderate bitter, subtle sweetness, highly drinkable. In the aftertaste the nice bitterness gets a bit more intense, round and smooth, the smoke fits in great and is not dominating the picture too much. The aftertaste is long, nice dry malty-bitter with a great layer of smoke around. Great beer!

Ungespundet at Akkurat, Stokholm.
Big brown and lasting head.
The typical red-brown color as their Märzen.
The aroma is a bit more intense than their normal Märzen that has almost a smoked sausage aroma. Strong warming alcohole and nice smoke taste. Fuller body and more a sipping beer than the Märzen.
Draft at Churchkey. Dark brown with small beige head. Tons of smoke, malt, and wood. The quintessential beer for the style. Great.

"Has somehow popped up twice in Reno on tap in the last month. Wont miss it this time. Beautiful mahogany red pour, firm head. Aroma of restrained smoke and sweet Brady malts with just a hint of hops. Misty wood and malt. Same in the flavor. Waaaay to easy to drink, smoke isnt over powering but obvious. Plays nice with the malty backbone with no trace of alcohol. Smooth with a thin finish. Definitely worth a shot. "

Deep plum color with a fairly white head. Aroma of awesome white oak smoke. Smooth palate almost creamy but not because theres enough carbonation to avoid that abomination. Only during whatever.. Im drinking this in June.

Keg at Marciero. Never thought I would get to drink my #1 wanted beer in Osaka! Deep dark brown with reddish orange tints, low fine head quickly gets lacy. Great nose: smoke, bacon, caramel, some chocolate, orange. Amazingly drinkable beer, rather sweet but no where near cloying, medium smoke (less than their Marzen), caramel, chocolate, light hops with orange and grass. Prefect body, light but full and smooth and low carbonation. Wonderful beer, the best I have had from them.

Draught sample at Fermentoren in Copenhagen. Pours brown with a huge head, aroma is smoked with wood, vanilla , cheese and floral tones, flavor of smoked cheese, smoked fish, vanilla, cheese, sweet and pleasant, medium bodied.
On tap at Fermentoren. Clear brown with beige head. Aroma is smokey, pork, nuts and earth with a balanced smokiness. Taste is similar; smoke, caramel, earth and nicely balanced smoke notes.
Dark clear brown with milky off white head. Aroma and taste of toast, smoke, caramel, and wheat. Light-medium body and light carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a creamy long lasting off-white head. Campfire aroma. Overpowering smoke flavor with notes of bacon and a hint of caramel. Has a sweet malty finish with long lasting smoke aftertaste.
Draft. Cola colored with ruby tints and a big tan head. Aroma is bacon, campfire and a hint of dark fruit. Taste adds some banana/bubblegum and char. Light sticky mouthfeel. Great.

4oz pour at Churchkey comes a clear, caramel brown with some cloudy, beige head. Nose is meaty, smoked pork bones, wet acorns, some roasted squash, earthy. Flavors are the same, sundried corn, acorn, Jamon Iberico, caramel, a little roasted parsnip. Mostly clean, mildly meaty finish. Solid.

Tap: Finally able to try this one after a long time spent tracking it down. Beautiful copper-y, red-tinted body with only mild clarity; a thick, foamy, ecru cap sits softly on top, almost showing the same light red tint as the beer below it. Aroma is lovely, lovely smoke! Mild meat-y, bacon-like smoke with undertones of charred campfire wood, toasted nuts, & a hint of sweet liquid smoke. Time opens up some more modest malt notes; caramely & woodsy. Smooth, smoked sausage over a campfire on the palate, the smoke transfers excellently to the taste. Both sweet & smoked with very nice balance. Successive sips reveal more malt complexity; toasted nuts, caramel, wood chips, hickory. Notable earthy, slender hop bite on the back of each sip. A masterful smoked beer, theres a reason these guys are "the ones who do the smoked beers". Delicious in every sense of the word.

Tap @ The Beer Mongers for 4:20 Smoke and Dank Beer Fest... Poured deep brownish/mohagony with a thin, retaining, khaki head. Aroma of campfire smoke, and charred sugars. Nice smokiness and ashy grains with a mild mouthfeel. Charred wood and toasted sugars.  Clean and smokey from start to finish. Cream of the crop when it comes to Rauchbiers.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Huge whale on draft. Cloudy reddish in color with a small white head.  Large smokey lovely note that leaves my manhood longing for deep love. Moderate bacon and pulled pork with some salty notes. Moderate for a schlenkerla in terms of smoke but definitely a star and definitely a smoke forward beer, even compared to other rauchbiers

Pours a hazy amber color, thin off white head. Huge smoke bomb aroma, pure liquid smoke extra...holy crap. Flavor is just pure smoke flavor, woody, sweet, vanilla, and just a shit ton more smoke. Campfire.

Pour out of growler, thanks a ton Aaron! Clear dark reddish brown pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of bacon, cherry wood, earth, nice dark fruit notes, some bitter grain, nice oaky tones, smells nice. Taste is a mix of dark fruit, oak, smoke, hints of bacon, woody notes with some meaty notes into a bit of grain, finishing bitter, smoky, dry. Very tasty, much more balanced than the other schlenkerla brews.

Growler to my Schwarzer Hahn ("Black Cock") glass @ home, sent by alexsdad06. Growler was filled in Cincinnati and consumed immediately upon arrival. Big thanks to Brad to going out of his way to get me this filled. Ive been in Bamberg on four occasions but never around Lent, so this is my first opportunity to try this bad boy. Re-rate coming when I eventually get to try it fresher vom fass in Bamberg sometime in the future.
Slightly hazy dark copper appearance with a soft tan head. Aroma is very thick. Some meatiness (bacon / pork) but not like their Märzen. A bit of ash present. Whats really crazy is how full of thick, bready malts are in the nose. Some burnt toffee / caramel. I also get a bit of white fruit (apple/pear/apricot) in the aroma. Very thick and porridge-like flavor / mouth feel. Nicely dry without a ton of residual sugars. Very doughy / bready flavor. Hints of fruity notes. Some black pepper spiciness, especially on the finish. Definitely some caramel and ash, but again, not all that sweet. Super smooth finish. Slightly chalky. Aftertaste kind of reminds me of after eating gravy drenched dumplings in the Czech Republic. Surprisingly vibrant and fresh for the distance that this one has traveled. Definitely will re-examine next time Im in Franconia in the early Spring, but this was a treat tonight. LeninCat ticked this @ 4/5 ticks.
Draft; Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of smoked meat, & campfire; Flavor of slight smoked sweet malt, caramel, hops, and some fruit notes; Nicely balanced; Good.
2 hearty half liter draft pours. Darker amber colored lager, plenty of smoke all around, lighter and easy finish with lingering meatiness. Nice.

How to rate yet another Schlenkerla? From the tap on site, ruby red brown color with just a lovely off white to tan colored head. Aroma of meaty smoke and slight grass. Flavor follows with lovely bready malts under it all and faint caramel, all finishing with a touch of hop bitterness which Ive never noticed before in beers from this brewer. Mouthfeel was so lovely, full, smooth too. A great experience.

0.5 l draught @ Schlenkerla, Bamberg. This is similar to the more common rauchbiers from the same brewery, but with almost twice as much smoke aroma. Even the smell but also the taste has almost tar like smokiness. This heavy stuff, even with not so much of alcohol as you would think.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a clear deep amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have a savory smoked character, some fruitiness, more meaty, some campfire, earthy at the back. This has so much flavor and a lower abv. A nice Lenten treat.
Poured a reddish amber with an off white head. Aroma is sweetly rauched and lightly sweet. Medium body, flavour is much as the aroma.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good; a transparent amberish copper with off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; smoked ham. Tastes like it smells with a touch of sweetness from the malt. A bit of leather too. Average on the palate. Good, but I couldnt drink much of it.

On tap at Dutchs. Holy crap, this stuff is hearty! Very big, heavy body for a 5.5% beer, "snack already included" indeed! Medium to bigger body overall, with a big, rich smokey flavor to it. Smooth, kind of creamy, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Pours a half hazy very dark red color, with a thin off-white head. Leaves splotches and some dots of lace. Savory taste, moderate sweet, light to moderate bitter. Very good, intense stuff! Unique.. Quite different from the other Aecht beers Ive tried, but excellent in that Schlenkerla way.

Vom Faß im Schlenkerla, Bamberg. - Schwarzbraun mit rotgoldenem Schimmer, reichlich sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - Wie beim Schlenkerla Märzen dominieren tiefe, schwere Aromen von Karamel, Blockmalz, Schwarzwälder Schinken, Rauch und erdigem Hopfen, aber beim Fastenbier ist alles eine Stufe milder, reicher und fülliger. Die Rauchnoten sind in weiche Süße eingebettet. Sahniges Mundgefühl. Mild rezent. Im Nachtrunk leicht herber Hopfen mit Noten von Zitrone und Pfeffer. - Ein Bier wie flüssige Bayrisch Creme; unglaublich reich und komplex und dabei doch süffig. Ein Grund, jedes Jahr in der Fastenzeit nach Bamberg zu fahren.

16/03/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bevuta al FrankenFest. Ambrata viva con riflessi vermigli, bellissimo cappello di schiuma bianca morbida, molto persistente. Al naso le note affumicate si fondono magnificamente con quelle di caramello, senza che nessuna delle due componenti predomini sullaltra. In bocca è ugualmente equilibrata, molto elegante, la base di malto è leggera, laffumicatura gentile e non eccessiva, note minerali, grande beva. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Altro capolavoro di questo fantastico birrificio.
Dark amber/brownish body, small offwhite head. Aroma is smokey and caramel. Taste is sweet, mild smokey, caramel. Long smokey finish. Medium body, soft carbonation
Pours in dark amber body with low head. Aroma has smokey notes, light bacon, caramel. Taste has bacon sweetness as well, low earthy bitterness. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Gravity cask @ Akkurat. Pours a beautiful red-brown color with a small white head. Aroma is dominated by smoke, also notes of wood. Taste is smokey, but not as smoked as the aroma nor other offerings from this brewer. Its also sweet with notes of chocolate, apricots and reisin. Mouthfeel is just incredible with its lightness and crazy smoothness.

Cask (gravity) @ Akkurat.
App: Dark amber/redish brown with a slight mist and a porous beige/yellowed head.
Aroma: Malty with caramel, bread, bacon/tar smoke, spicy wooden notes, some dried fruit.
Taste: Sweet and rich flavour with caramel, sweet dark bread, raisins and oranges and a nice smoky spicy bitter finish.
Palate: Medium bodied, soft low carbonation, oliy soft texture.
Overall: I really love Akkurat for hooking us up with this stuff.

Cask at Akkurat, March 2014.

A bit hazy dark amber with a medium head. Aroma of smoke, ham, wood and some fruit. Similar taste. Nicely balanced and very, very drinkable. I would love to drink this one again.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Nice, soft, smoked aroma. Light hazy brown color. Huge, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet, smoked, light roasted flavor. Medium-full body. Creamy texture. Long dry finish. Really good. Full of smoky aroma and taste and still very drinkable.
FDBK 2010 The head is good, body, red-brown. It smells aromatic, smoky intensive. The taste is very aromatic, malty, smoky, les hoppy. Delicious. 4

Il prodotto più riuscito della linea Schenkerla, infatti è anche la meno reperibile. Lho trovata una sola volta alla spina e mi davvero stupito. Elegante, equilibrata, affumicata e ben maltata, con una puntina di amarognolo anche se smorzato dalla forza dellaffumicatura. Se la trovate, prendetela assolutamente!

draught at Zly Casy, Prague. Amber-copper colour, creamy beige head. Lovely intensive smoke aroma. Medium-bodied, intensive malty base with a good amount of smoke, pleasantly hoppy which ads a spicy touch. Delicious stuff!

On tap at Yards smoke beer event. Aroma was slight meat and caramel. Pours bronze with a nice lager head. Taste is sweet with caramel, biscuit, smoked meat, root beer and leather. All in all, a very easy rauchbier to quaff down.
Its like drinking a sigar. Beer is slightly bitter with some yeasty sweetness. But the dominant taste is of course the intense, face-filling explosion of smoke. Sehr gut!

Draft at Redlight. Deep ruby pour with a bubbly white head. Big hickory smoke aroma, ash, wood with a nutty and toffee malt backing. Flavor is very balanced with barbeque sauce, hickory wood, sweet malty backing. Smooth drinking palate with moderate carbonation. I love this.

Keg at British Craft Beer Challenge. These Schlenkerlas are all quite samey (not necessarily a bad thing), deep brown colour, smokey nose, clean malt background, notes of bacon and maple syrup, well balanced bitterness to finish. This is perhaps less aggressively smoked than others, more drinkable. Very pleasant.

Draught at Breukelen Bier Merchants NYC.  Pours brown clear some lace after a dissipating head.  Aroma is delicious smoke, bbq spice, light red fruit.  Flavor is a perfect balance of those over moderate sweetness and bitterness.  The finish is woody and smoky.  The feel is lively, dense full and heavy.  Super awesome.

On tap at Churchkey.  Poured crimson red with small beige head which dissapates quickly.  Aroma is nice smoke, little lacing, light body, and low carbonation.  Taste is nice smoke and some meat.  Not a lot a flavor, but quality and enjoyable.  I remember liking Aecht Weizen better.

Keg at Euston Tap. Easy drinkable beer despite the smokeyness and the dark brown color. Body is thin and mauthfeel is dry. Lightly hoppy and smoky nose. Palate is pleasant with a strong smoked finish. A bit weak and disappointing given the high rating.

Tap: Poured a clear light maple color ale with a small foamy head with average retention. Aroma consists of smoked malt with light woody notes and floral undertones. Taste is dominated by easy drinking notes of smoked malt with light wood notes and floral undertones. Body is full with somewhat of a fat mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Great mix between complexity and drinkability.

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Hazy brownish red shade with an off-white head. Very punchy smoke factor in the aroma at first; just like smoked sausage. Sadly it doesnt last all the way through the glass. Higher carbonation than I expected and just about winning the battle to stay above lightness of body. Very tasty and well done smokiness but on this evidence I dont really see why it ranks top for its style.
Keg at the euston tap. Big sausage maple  glaze smokey aroma. Caramel colour small beige head. Sticky caramel toffee sausage. Smoke. Quite sweet. Medium carb.

Tap @ Euston Tap. Clear dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate smoky - bacon. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270413
On draft at pizzeria Paradiso old town.  Pours a fairly clear amber with an off white head.  Malty aroma.  Smoky malt flavor.  Smooth and tasty.

Draught @ The White Horse on Parsons Green. The pours deep ruddy reddish brown with a small head. The nose is of honey glazed smoked ham. Donut. Rich but not overpowering smokey accents. The taste is more of the same. Rich, nutty malts. Rustic smoked ham. Sweet bakery bread and light chocolate. Wonderfully smooth, well-rounded stuff. Nice and creamy on the palate. Medium body, soft carbonation. Overall, smoked beers arent really my thing, but its impossible to fault this. Great.

On tap at Tørst with Max, Ramy, GT & Whitney, Podey, and maybe some others later.  Pours a clear amber brown with a medium sized beige head.  Lovely campfire on the nose, crisp malt behind it.  Medium bodied, smooth malt, a bit of sweetness, some caramel notes.  Not the omnipresent smoke that permeates many of their beers, this is much easier and subtler.  Gentle smoke lingers on the finish.  Lovely stuff.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 Draft at proletariat with Andrew, PJ, Brendan and Dubra. Pours a hazy amber body with no head and very light lacing. Aroma is pulled pork, wood, earthy bacon and light shoe polish. Mouthfeel is super drinkable considering the rich meaty flavors displayed. This has got to be one of the best smoked beer Ive had to date. Wonderful, cheers.

This poured a lighter brown color with a beige head. Aroma was of fairly heavy smoke, light roasted malt, and Bacon. Flavor was similar, very well integrated smoke but not ashy without sweetened malts.
Draft. Amber pour with tan head. Smoked aroma dominates.  Flavor is less smoky than other aecht smoked brews.

On tap @ In De Wildeman. Nice clear copper to brown color. Off white, quite dense head. Aromas: some (smoked cheese or fish), biscuity malt, caramel. Flavor is medium sweet, smokey. Body is quite full for this strength. Finishes dry and medium bitter. Nice!

Draught.
Originally rated on 20100212.
Pours murky brown color with a medium sized head. Aroma of smoke, burnt malts, caramel and yeast. Flavor of caramel, dark roasted malts, smoky ham, some toffee and yeast. Delicious.

Had on draught at the Schlenkerla brewpub.  The pour is hazy deep brown with a reddish tint and a big tan head.  The nost is strong bacon, smoked meats with some nice caramel and grassy notes.  The taste is amazingly well balanced sweet and bitter.  The mouthfeel is soft and smooth, heavy body and a long finish.
draft at Schlenkerla, dark ruby pour, smoking, smoked meats, bacon, ham. full mouthfeel. pretty complex. paired well with the Bamberg onion

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 12.04.2010
Aroma is smoky with tar notes, some grainy malt and woody notes. Flavour is rather smoky with tar, some licorice, hints of salt and distant woody notes. Also some grainy malt occurs at the end of the glass. Good, something between Märzen and Urbock.

On tap. Brown amber color with a nice off white head. Aroma is smokey, bacon, ham,fire. Smells really good! Taste follows aroma. Smokey, campfire and bacon. Also get som nice caramel maltiness in there.

Draught (from earlier notes of february 2010). Dark amber in color with a creamy off-white head. Aroma has some smoke, ham or bacon and some wood is also present. Nice aroma. Taste is quite smoky and hints of some wood and bacon. Smooth overall with some chocolate in aftertaste.

On tap at Maxs Taphouse in Baltimore. Served in a pint glass.

Cloudy dark brown body with a wonderful rocky head and excellent head retention.

Aroma has tons of smoke, bacon, along with some dark fruit. Smells a lot like a campfire.

Lots of smoke on the taste with cooked meat. There is also a pleasant fruityness reminiscent of figs and raisins. Definitely some bacon. There is a little tartness but it is not over the top. Mouthfeel is full with a slightly sticky finish. 

Probably the best rauchbier I have every had. The smoke is extremely intense and over the top but yet there are numerous other subtle flavors that manage to come through. Im extremely fortunate to have tasted this beer and I really hope I find it again sometime.

Ughhh, my god this tastes terrible, but I guess I have to give it an honest review for the style.  Aroma:  Smoked meat, Appearance:  normal appearance, dark with a strong head.  Taste:  absolutely awful, like Im drinking smoked meats with dirty cigarettes stuffed in.  Palate:  Dont care.  Overall its an impressive smoked, but frankly smoked usually sucks, so take it as you will.

Sörmanufaktúra, Budapest. Nagyon picit zavaros, világosabb árnyalatú vörösesbarna színe van, habja közepes méretű, igencsak kitartó, krémes állagú és bézs színű, szép. Illata finoman füstös, malátás és fás is egyben, emellett füstölt húsos és nagyon finoman gyümölcsös és karamellás, ami kicsit mássá teszi a főzde többi sörétől. Rendkívül kiegyensúlyozott ízéről hasonló jókat lehet elmondani,a komló kellemes keserűt is ad neki, szinte tökéletes. Finoman száraz és meglepően frissítő, ami a könnyedebb testnek is köszönhető. Remek darab, remélem a legközelebbi szezonban is lesz pár hordó!

On tap at Novare Res, Portland ME in April 2010. Took a long time to pour - the bar tender was struggling with the head /  carbonation level. Dark brown. Fluffy beige head. Seemed a little less bacon character in the aroma than the normal Schlenkerla although it may been muted by being served rather cold. Still plenty of smoke on the palate. Very drinkable and surprisingly refreshing.
Smells and tastes like bacon, which is impressive, but not enjoyable for me.  Its really smoke all over, too much for me.

Location/Date:Draft at Smoke & Barrel on August 14th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a dark cloudy brown. 
Aroma: Aroma is of smoke and bacon.
Taste: Nice amount of medium bitterness, smoke, faint bacon.
Palate:Medium body, quick finish.
Summary: I know this was the highest active smoke beer on Ratebeer, but I never imagined Id like this so much. I dont even like real smoke, yet this was really really tasty.  Would love to have again.

On tap at Milltown a while back. Nice job getting this gem in, Ethan! Terrific velvety dark copper beer, with a massive silky head. Nose is straight bacon, son! Taste is, while still powerfully rauchy, even more complex, with modest notes of fruit, yeast, and caramel giving shape to the smoke and in turn being held together by that common, intense ingredient. A real treat, loved it.
The worst beer ever! If i live woodfire-taste in your mouth, the u like It.... I try a bottle but I dont reached the bottle bottom :-(

On draft at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia.

A: Cloudy, reddish orange hues. Small to medium head with little lacing.

S: This is where all Aecht Schlenkerla beers excel. This beer smells like a beautiful late summer campfire. Charred meat, heavy smoke, summer sausage, and burnt malt.

T: The taste falls directly in line with the aroma. This isnt necessarily a complex brew, but it has amazing, unique flavors that make this beer a must try. It has similarities to a fine Islay scotch, like Lagavulin. Its like drinking in a campfire. Really tasty, and pairs very well with strong cheeses and meat.

M: Thin feel, moderately low carbonation.

D: Its really easy to drink this beer. However, one is plenty for me, as the smokiness, while done expertly, and mouthfeel lower the rate of consumption.
Ein Biergenuss der seines gleichen sucht. Beliebt wegen seines rauch Schinkengeschmacks

On tap at zly Casy in Prague. A reddish shade of brown with a lasting off-white head; aroma with a good whiff of peaty smoke and burnt grass; curious hazelnut liqueur sweetness with a firm but light texture, the smoke quality is mild but intriguing. No surprises that its a delicious schlenkerla

On tap at Zly casy. Dark unclear brown color. Aroma is smoked meat and taste is even more smoked meat. :) Ive had quite a few smoked beers recently, but nothing comes even close to Schlenkerla Fastenbier. This is the prototype of smoked beer for me.

On tap at Brasserie V - Pours mahogany with a thin tan head. Nose is the smoky, meaty malt Im looking for, but dialed back just a bit. Not sweet, which is nice. Bready, lightly toasted malt comes through as well. Bready, lightly yeasty, with a nice mellow smoke and a sweetness that isnt overbearing. Really smooth, with velvety carbonation. Unbelievable.

Draught at Of Love and Regret (very cool new Baltimore bistro bar). Very dark amber color. Smoky-salty aroma. Very heavy, frothy lacing and nice body. Smoky and malty, and a teeny bit of soapy taste. Long term quite peaty... great for serious scotch lovers like my wifey (says it?s just about perfect!).

On tap at Landmark 1800.  Deep ruby with a thin white head.  Aroma of peat, smoked malts and not much else.  Taste is a one trick pony of smoky meat/malts with some sweetness lurking underneath.  I couldnt finish this one.

14oz sample at Beer Revolution in Oakland.  The aroma on this is suprising--sweet, spicy, and lightly smoked.  A bit of a peaty character is also there.  Reminiscent of an Islay scotch like Lagavulin.  Transparent amber body with a small off-white head, which dissipates fairly rapidly.  Starts with the hallmark smoked malty flavors, but it becomes a bit sweet and caramelly.  Some chocolate flavors are also present.  This beer is full-bodied and very balanced.  Not overly smoky, just right.  Really enjoyable brew.

Tap. Pours clear amber/ruby with thick, creamy off-white head; good retention and lacing. Aroma is smoked bacon, caramel malt, cherries, earthy hops, and woody notes. Flavor is somewhat watery; malt forward with faint supporting hops and fruit esters; smoke undertones throughout with a dry finish. Medium body with low carbonation and warmth.

Draught, Redlight Redlight.  Amber colour.  Lots of smoke, in the Heller style.  Mild for a Schlenkerla, with brighter biscuity amber malts.  Quite dry in the finish.  Still quite smokey overall, but for the brewery perhaps less than most beers.  A less brash version, but I prefer the brash.  Look forward to getting this from the barrel, however.

On tap at Ølbaren, Copenhagen.
Very dark red.
Easy drinking, smoky, but not very heavy on the bacon. Dryness, a hint of oak, lovely lacing on the glass.Dry pleasant finish. Would be lovely with rustic food.

Pours a shark copper brown with two fingers of sandy tan head.  Nose is super smokey with lots of cured meat and hints of caramel.  A light fruitiness with notes of fig and hay.  An intensely smoky flavor as I expected.  Grassy hops and hints of caramel.  Dry with a soft carbonation and a light hop bite.  Awesome.

Draft at redlight. Gorgeous. Dark rich. Aroma of charred and caramelized wood. Silky oily mouthfeel is hot in the finish. Dry, toasty, nearly burnt wood blended with the characteristic sweetness of the rich caramelly malt, singing in unison. I could fast on this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft from wooden cask at Lagerhaus (Palm Harbor, FL).  It pours a slightly cloudy auburn color with a billowy foamed tan head.  The smoked malt is immediately noticeable in the aroma, but upon first sip it completely engulfs you, in a good way.  This is truly a delicious beer.  Glad I was able to finally find and try this one given the extremely small window of opportunity.

Layered reddish brown with a thick just off-white head, lots of lace.  Nose is fairly light, toasty malt, some hints of whats to come.  Flavor is where its at in this beast.  Super drinkable while maintaining a excellent rauch flavor.  delish.  I could easily fast with this.

From the cask at the Schlenkerla.  0.5 litre served in Schlenkerla glass.  Had a copper colour, very hazy, two finger thick head, oily on top.  Strong meat smell that over powered the malt and hops that might have been there.  Tasted less smoke than the Maerzen, earthy with hints of clove and sweetness. Very smooth mouthfull, almost silky.  Very easy to drink, must drink Bamberg beer.

On tap at TR 307  
 Aroma:   clean , dry smoke, ash pit, beech wood. Classic nose.8-
 Appearance:   golden with slight haze. Large white frothy top. Nice lace presented.
 Palate / Taste:  Mild, easy going. Mineral accents on clean mid intense smoke hints. Simply- Classic Rauch bier.
marrone buona schiuma media persistenza prosciutto di praga corpo medio non molto amara discreto affumicato

On tap at Fermentoren. Pours a clear dark brown with an off-white head. Sweet with a light bitterness. Aromas of smoked malts and hints of caramel malts. Also aromas of dried fruits. Medium to full bodied. Very soft carbonation. Long lightly dry finish with more smoked malt aromas.

Split pea soup with ham and a strong smoke component on the nose. Clear copper, thin head. Malt forward, split pea flavor. Smoke makes a late appearance. Im normally repulsed by anything vegetal, but this was a very pleasant vegetable flavor. Cam highly recommended, and it is enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2012 On tap at the Farmhouse. Expectations were through the roof for this one. Pours a beautiful sparkling brown with red shades, small beige head that lasted the whole time. Aroma: Incredibly refined, the smoke isnt overpowering. Smoke malts present themselves as charred wood, sea shells and grilled meat. The meaty aspect is not as present as in most smoked beers. The sea-like aroma reminded me of Islay scotches. Caramel shines through the smoke. Smoke allows even more room for caramelized malts, dark fruits and burnt toast. This is round and oily and as light as a smoke should be. Highly drinkable, of course. A balance masterpiece.

On tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill (Burlington). Appearance: Dark amber with a small white head. Aroma: Strongs notes of smoke, bacon., hints of hops. Taste: Smoked, bacon, wood, malt and a slight bitterness. Overall: Wow! Really not a fan of "smoked" beers, but this one is impressive. Highly drinkable and incredibly well balanced.

What a great brew. Redlight Redlight - tap. I couldnt wait to try this one. Aromas consist of pulled pork with some light bread and campfire notes. This one was a clear brown with an off-white head...I think...it was sorta dark in RR. The taste was amazing. Solid smoky notes of BBQ with some crisp bready notes. This one was perfectly balanced and drinkable as hell with the smokiness not being overpowering at all.
On tap @ Redlight - pours a dark red/brown with a white head. Aroma is upfront smoke, as is taste with a great malty and light bitter finish. Solid rauchbier that I would definitely drink agin.

Draft at Monks. Poured a dark amber reddish brown with a pillowy white head. Noticeable smokey aroma, though the smokey taste is much milder than expected. Smoothly blends with the dark malt. Woody. Charcoal. Leather. Slight sweetness is present that balances the heavier flavors quite well. The overall effect though is quite mild. Would be a good place to start for drinkers wanting to try, but a bit scared of, rauchbiers.

What a find here in FL! Also on tap! The scent was full of roasted malts and ham with some charcoal in the mix. For a smoked beer, the meaty flavors were light and acceptable among the robust malt character. I could get into smoked beers if there were more like this.
I dont think you can get a better rauchbier. Nice bar-b-q aroma. Pleasant smokey taste that is not too faint and not too overpowering.  Thanks, Redlight Redlight for bringing this one in.

Enjoyed due to hawkeye tap-spotting from a friend.  Thanks, Tom!
Dark, cloudy, red-brown pour with a creamy off-white head.  Aroma is deeply toasted bread, nice caramel, and layers of inviting wood-smoke.  
Taste is lightly sweet with smoked almonds, brown sugar, and cured meat notes.  Very well balanced, the smoke does not overpower.  Medium body, lightly creamy texture, and ample but soft carbonation.  Only a hint of phenol in finish.  Very drinkable.  I was a bit skeptical when I noticed some of the other reviews referring to this beer as being very clear in appearance.  Any doubts were dispelled as I enjoyed this lovely, whole, unfiltered gem.

Draught.  Rootbeer-float-foamy head persists for ten minutes with creamy lacing over an dark amber body.  Aroma is umami, smoke, and produce.  Taste is umami and bitter.  Palate is light and creamy with fine and lively carbonation.  Excellent rauchbier

Enjoyed on tap at Aecht Schlenkerla in Bamberg, Germany.  Appearance is a very murky dark brown, rich off white head.  Aroma a hint of smoke, subtle bacon aroma, yeast as well, unique.  Taste is a very heavy body, no carbonation, not too rich but is just thick.  Smoke flavor is subdued, like a less-smokey but thicker rauchbier.  Not bad but i prefer my previous brew.

Murky, cloudy toffee colored pour. Big tan head that leaves plenty of lacing behind the slow fall. Nice smoky aroma with malt and nuts mixed in. Not as smoky as their bottled offerings. Smoky and malty flavor. Nice, very nice.

Sörmanufaktúra, Budapest, csapolva.
Világosabb, vörösesbarna színe van, belül enyhén opálos. Habja közepes méretű, krémes és jól tartja magát. Illata malátás, bükkfa füstös, karamellás és kissé édeskés. Határozottan érezni az ízében is a karamellát, aminek az édessége szinte tökéletes egyensúlyt teremt a füstölt maláta és a komló kesernyéssége között, amihez jön egy kis diós, fás, aroma is. Könnyű de nem vizes teste van és mérsékelten pezsgő. Utóíze kellemesen füstös, kissé húsos és enyhén száraz. Veszélyesen könnyen csúszik és igen kiegyensúlyozott sör, nagyon finom.

On tap at the Rake, 9th April 2011 and again on the 19th. Deep reddish brown with little head. Very strange nose and flavour, a mix of smokiness and fruitiness. Smoked quince is the closest I can come to a succinct summary. Nose is smoke, smoke and more smoke.

On tap @ Sörmanufaktúra, Bp.
Opalesque reddish dark brown with a creamy off-whte head.
Smoky, malty nose.
Complex and tart aroma with caramel, burnt wood and smoke underpainted by notes of alcohol.
Slick/oily palate.
Long, dry finish escorted by tart citrusses, dark chocolate and spices.
Fine one.

From the barrel at the Fermentoren, Copenhagen, Denmark.
Dark reddish brown colour with no head.
Strong smokey aroma with woody and malty notes. Smooth smokey and woody flavour. No carbonation. Malty and smokey aftertaste. Excellent.

On tap at Washington Commons. Pours a slightly hazy orange brown with a super thick off white head. Aroma of smoked malt, smoky meats, and light fruits like apple. Flavor starts off with smoked meats, becomes sweet mid-palate and finishes smoky/charred with some leather. A great blend of smoked malts and sweet fruits. Unlike some of the other Schlenkerla beers, it is light in palate, crisp and dry. My favorite Schlenkerla for sure, although less meaty than others.
8/4/9/5/16 (4.2/5)

Draft at 33. Pours an initially cloudy reddish-brown that clears up after a minute. Finger of off-white head. Smooth, smoky aroma- dried, cured meats, toasted sugars, lightly smoked wood, and spices. Very even. The flavor is even more subtle, with smoked wood, dried salty meats, caramel and brown sugar, with mild spices. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation. Doesnt linger very long. This is a good entry beer for the smoked category, particularly in comparison to the others from this brewery.

Tap at Smoke and Barrel. This beer is awesome!!! Black pour with a tight frothy tan head. Huge bacon and smoked barley malts in the nose with big caramel and molasses in the back. A moderate creaminess leads to big bakers chocolate, and a smoked salmon finish. Thick rich palate with caressing carbonation and a roasty finish.

Tap at DGBD for St Patricks day brunch.  Pours black with dense head.  Nose of wood smoke and breakfast Buffett.  Tastes of grass, malt, dark fruit and lots of smokey bacon.  If its lent and u cant have meet cuz its Friday grab this lent beer to stop the craving because its baconlishess

Draught at Smoke and Barrel DC. Gorgeous dark brown/cola colored pour with reddish tints. Nose holds beautiful classic Schlenkerla beechwood smoke, roasted malt, and some touches of cream and beautiful light malty fruit. Same in the flavor, with further balance that really puts this beer into the creme de la creme of smoked beers, and better than those aggressive, less balanced beers like the Urbock. Awesome stuff.

Vom Fass at Schlenkerla. Aromatic smoke sweet Aroma. Cloudy brown, Offwhite lacing cream. Medium Body, soft mellow mouthfeel. Sweet base, wooden smoke, wood aromatics, roast, minerals/salt,light perfumed and grassy hops in the background. Sweet smoky finish. Smoked roast and grass aftertaste

This is the best smoked beer I have had. A big aroma of smoke and peat.

The  Mild flavors are bread, fruit, mild chocolate, wood and caramel.

The strong flavors are smoke, flame and meat. It was really blended well.

Im Geruch rauchig mit leichtem Malzton. Süßmalziger Antrunk mit leichter Rauchnote. Mittelstück stärker buchenholzrauchig mit malzigem Oberton. Abgangs dann schwächer im Rauch, schokoladenmalzig. Echt gut.
Festival der Bierkulturen, Köln - 14.05.2011

On tap at Beer Revolution. It pours a murky reddish brown with a small tan head. The aroma is wonderful with salted meats, smoked wood and brown sugar. The flavor is incredibly smoky and smooth with hints of spicy wood. It has a fairly light body with low carbonation. Pretty dry finish, but with a tad of balancing sweetness. Somehow I could drink pint after pint of this and not grow tired of it despite the intense flavor. Thats the beauty of this beer.

Pours clear mahogany with a huge tanned head leaving fine lacing. Aroma is smokey, sweet, malty, leather, fruity; very nice. Flavor is smokey like salty salami, fruity, sweet and nicely bitter. Yet quite dry. Finishes dry and bitter.

On tap. Pours with a clear amber-bronze hued body with a just off-white head. Aromas are smokey, bacon, chlorophenols (rubber), malty, melanoidin, maple, grainy and cereal. Flavors are malty, nearly peat medicinal smoke. Smokey, bacon, malty, cereal, smoked salmon. Medium bubbles, lively. Finishes on the crisper side of things. I think this is a good smoked beer, but I do not like smoke beers, and that said it is not one of the best that I have had.

Draught Good, very fine & dense light-greige head, textbook lace over mahogany clear beer. Smoked ham jumping out of the glass, superbly inviting, inciting hunger, aromas. Smoked & coloured malts. Seems lighter in flavour than the Märzen? Smoked, faintly phenolic and a bit of real saltiness (as from fruits de mer) and bready, sweeter than the Märzen. LIght(er), faintly watery MF but extremely clean palate despite the phenols. All the same, excellent. How they had it out of season?
On tap at Trion Tavern. Smoke, dark fruit and malt aroma. Brown with a small white head. Smoky roasted malt flavor. I really love smoked beers, and this is a good one.
Draft. Rich amber beer with a whitish head. Nice smoke aroma with bacon and salt. Smoke and bacon flavor with malt. Medium bodied. Smoke and bacon lingers with malt.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 Tap.  Smokey meat, hay, and light prune malt aroma.  Dark brown color with small head.  Smokey sweet raisin and ham flavor.  Light bitter hay finish.    The sweetest of the Aecht Schlenkerla beers.
I had this on tap at backwoods bbqd.opaque brown pour nice smokey flavor and aroma, very nice
Draught @ Rymy-Eetu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 1.3.2010. Great and well balanced smoked beer with notes of hops, malts and slight bitterness.

Had this on draft at the old Moeder Lambic with Roman: Pours a deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma of smokey bacon and malts. Smoke flavors kick you in the tastebuds immediately, followed by an oily, hickory smoked sausage and bacon punch. I liked this brew, though it wasnt as thick and chewy as expected, still, tasty stuff. If you like the other Aecht Schlenkerla rauchbiers, it is a must try.

Draught.
Pours a dark, reddish brown, with a light brown head.
Malty, very smoky aromas, cured bacon, hops.
Off-dry, medium bodied, almost thick texture.
Malty, very smoky taste, iodine, cured bacon, licorice. (2011-04-27)

On tap at OConnors, Uppsala. Unclear mahogany with a medium-sized off-white head. Intense smoke but amazingly smooth mouthfeel! Toast, caramel, slight fruits, a bit of milk chocolate and a woody note, along with that intense, classic German smoke showing itself as smoked ham. Very flavourful beer! I was impressed.

The third and final hiccup from Pale Lager month is a little back-log thing for my 1700th rating.  Pours a deep amber color with a big fluffy white head. The aroma is smoky with some charred wood, smoked meat, and a mild maltiness... mostly it smells of sweet aromatic smoke and thats just fine. The flavor is surprisingly dry and bitter while maintaining that strong smoky character I hate to say smoked meat again as this does not actually taste like meat, but rather a bit like the smoke flavor you get with a very high quality smoked meat. The beer has a nice chocolate note to it as well, and this is perhaps one of the most complex of the Schlenkerla lineup. A real treat, I cant wait till it comes around next year.

Keg	Euston Tap	London.  A dark brown coloured beer with an off-white puddle of head.  Nice and smoky with more sweetness than other Schlenkerla beers.  Good lardon notes throughout.  Sophisticated.  Very tasty although I would have liked more smoke.  Still scrummy.

Dark copper color with a high and fine head. Pleasant smoky aroma with lots of bacon and roasted malts. Starts strong smoked, with lots of bacon and voluminous malt body. The aftertaste is smoky and pleasantly fruity, with lots of bacon again. In the further course, some aroma hops are noticeable, coupled with lots of smoke and bacon. Goes into a sweet and fruity, smoky finish!

On tap at Maxs. hazy tan-brown, thin cream head. Nose has a bit of sugared fruit, dusty, heavy smoke and light chocolate. Flavor is richer, not quite as sweet or fruty, pumpernickel, very dry, salty malt finish. Dry palate is great, long stinging smoke accents as a result. Bit too much dough at front. Overall more aggressive smoke than marzen, drier, more stinging, less earth and chocolate, more campfire than marzen, and ultimately, more enjoyable for a smokehead.

Superbly balanced. Great depth, toffee, smoked Gouda, dark cherries, a touch of brandy. More hoppy than expected with a subtle but very pleasant bitter finish. Finishing long with smoked ham  and toffee.  Kinda reminded me of my grandparents ham steak with plum sauce. Superb. Wow, by far the best smoked beer Ive ever had. Unbelievable.  Tastes much heavier than 5.5%. I had their Wiezen after this and it tasted  like water

Draught, at last!  Deep amber to amber coloured, stable white creamy head; moderate smoky-caramalty nose, hops underneath; moderate to solidsweet-bitter flavour,medium bodied, very smooth; lingering sweet caramelly and smoky - the smoke sticks to the palate -  finish with some hops in the very end. Great, well balanced, moreish stuff.....

On tap at Rustico - Alexandria. Served in a stange.

Pours a moderate brown color with some copper highlights. Off-white head forms at a few fingers and lingers for a bit before falling into a thin cap. A bit of lacing. The nose carries a light amount of oak as well as what is reminiscent of oak. Light malt with a bit of toast. Smoke is not overwhelming. Smoke hits the palate really well in the flavor--not overpowering, but definitely the dominant character. Light woody and earthy characteristics and a bit of toasted malt. The mouthfeel is really nice--a bit of smoke as well as an almost-creamy texture. Really, really well done. One of the best smoked beers Ive come across.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 05-11-2011

From a cask at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL, on 5/5/11.

Aroma:Theres just smoke in the aroma, with maybe a little malt hiding.

Appearance:Deep amber with very nice white head. Head has tiny bubbles and is long lasting. Moderate lasting.

Taste:On the foretaste, there is a little smokey flavor with a great malt sweetness, but in the midtaste it changes to a much more mature smokey deeper smokey flavor. On the aftertaste theres a small alcohol bite and a great nutty malt flavor.

Palate:Light to medium mouthfeel with low to moderate carbonation.

Overall:This is a wonderfully balanced rauchbeer with a lot of complexity.

Wooden cask at Churchkey.  Pours somewhat clear amber/brown with a medium, creamy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, cookie, caramel), light hops (spicy) with light fruity esters and huge smoke notes. Flavor is is heavy malt (bread, cookie, caramel), light hops (spicy) with light fruity esters and huge smoke notes and bacon/meat.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation with a sweet finish.

Churchkey, DC cask 14oz ($8): Pours a brownish color, with not as much head, because of the cask pour. Aroma is of meat and smoke and malts and some hops. Not as much smoke as the more intense rauchs that this brewery comes out with (right before this I had some sips of Eiche, which is way smokier). However, this is definitely smokier than the helles. In any case, it a balanced smokiness. Upon tasting, the most surprising thing is the hops, which are way more plentiful than you would expect at first. Extremely well-balanced and manages to be a rauchbier without just being about the rauch. I could drink six-packs of this if they were around. Grand stuff.

Dark brown with off-white foam and aromas of - yes, smoke that overwhelms everything else! The taste is round and gentle, semi-sweet with lots of caramel, campfires and a slight bitterness. Very well balanced in the mouth, but according to my palate it gets a little monotonous after the first 25 cl has slid down.

Keg at the Rake a couple of times recently. Amber with a small flat head. No mistaking the brewer with all the familiar house characteristics. I bet that it is awesome fresh  from the wood in Bamberg, as Jan and Charlotte confirmed having been there for its brief annual appearance a couple of weeks ago.

A Mes rate. Draught at the Rake. Ive wanted this for years. How amazed am I to find it in the Rake. I wont bore you with the details. Schlenkerla. Smoke. Awesome. A little lighter and more drinkable maybe. Who gives a shit really. Amazing beer from a great brewery.

Feinrauchiger und angenehm malziger Antrunk. Die Rauchnoten verharren fast die ganze Zeit auf ihrem Anfangsniveau, das Malz und besonders der Hopfen steigern sich deutlich, um am Ende dann doch noch durch die Rauchigkeit eingeholt zu werden. Zum Ende leider recht trocken. Dunkel malzig, erdig getreidig. Sehr bitteres Finish, vorher kurz schokoladenmalzig. 12/11/11/12//12

Dark cloudy amber with a small head. Big smokey aroma, quite sweet. The flavour is smokey, with caramel malt, wood and a rising fruity flavour that is strong on the finish. The firm body excellently complements the robust smokiness.

Growler filled at Bierkraft.  Looks pretty clear to me. Medium dark brown with some orange highlights and a 1 1/2 finger beige head, fair retention.  Smoky wood and smoked dry meat aroma dominates, but doesnt seem as beat-you-over-the-head as the Urbock.  Also getting some toasted malt.  Flavor is still fairly smoky, but there is the addition of some lager yeast notes.  Some toasty malt followed by a bit of sweet grain follows through to a dry, earthy finish, bitterness peaking at a 2-3.  Soft light carbonation with a light to medium body.  Damn solid. Id even imagine someone that doesnt hate rauchbiers could find this quite appealing.  I could drink a lot of this.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Tap at the Euston Tap. Clear, light golden-brown with a soft head. Mild dark, smoked malts on the nose, slight minerals. Pretty sweet flavor, some brown sugar, glazed ham, smokey malts, light grass. Light to medium in body with average carbonation. Smokey finish with lingering notes of honey-glazed ham. This beer is SO good.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 Tap at Bavarian Lodge. Dark brown, iced tea color with a thin, clingy ring of foam. Smell of Gouda cheese that marks all Schenklera beers. First sip offers some big malts, but those are immediately swallowed up by the house smoked malt with the Gouda rind taste. But for a smoked beer, thats exactly what I expected, and I ordered it because thats just what I like.

Keg at Euston Tap.  Clear mid brown colour with thick cream head.  Smokey aroma.  Smooth and smokey in mouth.  Rather drinkable.  Probably more straightforward smoked than the other beers from same brewery.  Drinkable enough.  I rather like it.  Malts dont do a lot touch of toffee is al.

Low beige head. Near-clear mahogny colored body. Rich malty with a nice subtle smoke aroma. Suggestions of charcoal, wood and smoked meat. Crisp ashy and caramelly malt flavor, fairly dry with the smoke tones well intergrated. Properly hopped, nice balancing bitterness. Mid-bodied. Balanced. Super drinkability. Wow!
On tap @ The Rake, London. Pours a clear dark amber/red, with a medium off white head. Holy fuck this is smokey!!! Smokey, smoked bacon, salty, toffee, caramel and a slight roast. Delicious

The beer pours a dark amber color with a nice head and retention. 

The aroma is nice with the typical smoke and pork and at the end a little wood and bread.

The taste is super nice and easy to drink. Lots of smoke and bacon. 

The feel is nice and totally easy to drink.

clear amber, smooth white head.  aroma is smoked, pork,  flavor is very nicely dry malty, smokey, great balance betwen the smoked and the hoppymalty flavor  great tasting smoked beer with a caramelly roasted flavor. Great smoked

Tap. Huge two-fingers of a fluffy and creamy looking head on a brownish body. Rich bacon and smoked sausage aromas, very earthy and brilliantly smokey aroma. Smoked bacon continues in the flavor, very woody at points, mirrors aroma exactly. Oily, rich, and lush body.  This is nearly a meal, and a very great brew.

Tap @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated @ 25.2.2010.
Pours a brown colour with a decent white head. Smoky and sweet aroma of smoked malts and oak. Flavour of smoked malts, caramel, mild hops and oak. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Tasty.

Draught. Deep amber colour with small slightly off-white head. Aroma is roasted malts, some bread and smoked wet wood. Also some mild meaty and lleathery notes. Flavour is smoked wet wood, some mild meaty and leathery notes along with some sweeter malts.

(live at the Schlenkerla) Slightly hazy, dark amber colour with a reddish shine and a firm mid-sized slightly off-white foamy head. Toasty malty aroma with grainy spots and a touch of smoked ham. Moderately bitter flavour with a discreet malty sweetness, medium to light bodied with a smooth mouthfeel. Toasty and woody smokey taste with a whiff of caramel; quite dry and bitter finish with lingering flavours of smoked ham and delicately herbal and woody hops. Fantastic experience, too bad it is that limited. 09.II.08

Draught at Ölrepubliken.
Dark brown/copper. Medium, creamy, beige head.
Smooked wood, sausage and tar.
Sweet and moussy, slightly oily.
Licorice, tar and smoke in the flavour.

Draught. Reddish amber with off white head. Aroma of smoke, malt, grain and straw. A little smoke in flavour, grain and a little citrus. Fresh, delicious and very accessible. Id go for something smokier though when chosing a Schlenkerla.
